190501.name: Pines and Sunshine (Call of Cthulhu)
190501.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure takes place in New England, with a brief journey to Florida. The adventure is part of a series of adventures that are suitable for a campaign. The adventure is fairly challenging and is best undertaken by investigators who are at least moderately experienced.

User summary:

This adventure was also published for the Dark Conspiracy game.

190502.name: Player of Hell
190502.description:
From the introduction:

After the events in (c.f.) The Bookstore the investigators will have a brief interlude of peace. But, of course, this will not last. One of professor Preston's students will have the
misfortune of falling victim to a vrykolokas, or Greek vampire. After the initial attack, the student will confide in Preston, who will recognize the attack for what it is.

190503.name: Tong
190503.description:
User Summary

Tong is a game from Bruno Cathala illustrated by Camille Chaussy.

At your turn, you feed your chameleon from a row of insects. The chameleon then moves the same number of spaces as insects eaten. The first player who can't feed the chameleon (i.e. no insects available at the row) loses the game.

A print and play version of the game is available.

190504.name: Sea Food
190504.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure pits a group of investigators against a terrible foe, one who has been raised up from death into a grisly and hideous form by a descendent. While the investigators' ultimate enemy is the grisly revenant, they will have to cut their way through several levels of deception, not to mention several potentially dangerous opponents. Success will free the town of Bracken, Maine from a great evil. Failure will result in the destruction of the town and death (or worse) for its innocent inhabitants.

This adventure is fairly challenging for normal investigators and a minimum of three investigators is suggested. The adventure is set in 1996 and the action takes place in Maine. However, with some effort, it could be modified for an earlier time period or another setting.

190505.description:
Power Grid: High-Voltage DC Transmission Passage C was first released as day 24 of the Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015, and this mini-expansion is playable solely with the Power Grid map of Germany.

In future years, Germany plans a new high-voltage transmission line from North Germany to South Germany to deliver the electricity produced by wind power to the regions in South Germany with demand for that power. You are collectively building this transmission line, so step by step your power companies will not need to pay connection costs anymore between Cuxhaven and Stuttgart. Sadly, the construction of this transmission line is paid with tax money, so you must pay taxes to supply these cities with electricity.
190505.name: Power Grid: High-Voltage DC Transmission Passage C

190506.name: Secrets of the Kremlin
190506.description:
From the introduction:

Alexei Samsonov, who had achieved the rank of Major in the Red Army and would soon reach Colonel, sat relaxing in a small, private beerhall; in spite of its size it was the finest in all Berlin. The two men at the table with him were also officers, but they wore the uniform of the German Reichswehr. They had been drinking freely. They were not talking about their work. They were in too pleasant a mind to talk about their work, and it was forbidden anyway. The two men in Reichswehr uniforms asked him playfully to describe the girl they had seen on the Alexanderplatz, using Ancient Greek, and Samsonov replied that he would be glad to do so, but that he would first have to decline a certain noun in all its forms; he did not see his adjutant behind him until the man whispered in his ear.

190507.name: Seizure
190507.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure is a quite challenging one. Players must really think their way through situations, and Keepers can have a lot of fun toying and misleading the players without putting them in any danger. This adventure is probably best suited for experienced [Call of Cthulhu] players. They are more likely to yield on caution's side, whereas players of hack-and-slay games may rush in. Should this occur, the Keeper should throw some heat at them, be it law enforcement or a mild seizure.

User summary:

A Call of Cthulhu Adventure, recommended for three to five experienced players, set in 1962.

190508.name: Spirit of a Thief
190508.description:
From the introduction:

In 1748, an English sorcerer named Matthew Whitlock came to the New World to seek a safe haven in which to conduct his arcane researches. While traveling in what is now Maine, he encountered a local tribe and learned that they possessed artifacts of some power. In 1751, he stole some of these artifacts and returned to his cabin to continue his studies. Some months later, he met his death at the hands of a group of trappers, who encountered him while he was conducting an unspeakable ritual in the woods. After burning the sorcerer’s body, the trappers informed a traveling minister of what they had done. Aided by the trappers, the priest burned the sorcerer’s cabin and then sealed up the entrance to the chambers beneath it.

Unfortunately, Whitlock’s sorceries and terrible hatred permitted him to continue to exist after his death as a horrid wraith. This wraith has continued to exist since then, giving the area (known as "The Three Stones") an evil reputation.

User summary:

This adventure was self-published in 1994 and re-published on the web with minor corrections in 1996.

190509.name: Sticks and Twigs Like Men
190509.description:
From the introduction:

Primarily, this is a game about the tides being turned. There are plenty of false leads and switchbacks to keep our heroes guessing to the very end about what’s going on, and who the bad guy of the piece is. We hope to keep them in suspense, and give them a couple of chills along the way.

It’s also a game about scarecrows - specifically, scarecrows that come to life.

190510.name: Hellsing's Fire

videogamehonor.32225: 2011 IGF Awards Best Mobile Game of the Year Winner

190510.description:
When the implacable Professor Helsing and his assistant Raffton travel to The Shadow Blight, they'll need every weapon at their disposal to defeat Dracula's vampire horde. In this captivating, dark Gothic puzzle-adventure, use Dr. Helsing's powerful torch and tonics to save the world from the demonic uprising!

Source: The Developer Website.

190511.name: Dad 'N Me

videogamehonor.32228: 2006 IGF Awards Best Web Browser Game of the Year Winner

190511.description:
Experiment with the combo system to kill as efficiently as possible. Meet dad in the bad part of town.

Source: The Game Website.

190512.name: Swamp Bones
190512.description:
From the introduction:

Populated with alligators and poisonous snakes, the swamps of Florida are filled with danger. Occasionally, people die in those swamps. However, no one expected a university research team to vanish while cataloging swamp plants. The local authorities are baffled, so it is up to the investigators to find out why five people vanished in the swamp and a sixth person was found deathly ill and half insane.

This adventure is designed for a small group of moderately experienced investigators. It is set in the 1990s, but can be modified for a different time period.

190513.name: Dodge That Anvil

videogamehonor.32229: 2006 IGF Awards Best Web Browser Game of the Year Nominee

190513.description:
The sky is falling! Eastwarren's rabbits have been forced underground, and only one brave harvester stands between them and starvation. Travel through bountiful fields while unraveling the mystery of the perilous anvil storm. Be clever, be quick, and dodge that anvil!

Source: The Game Website.

190514.name: Tatterdemallion: An Experience in Fear
190514.description:
From the introduction:

At some stage of their lives, each of the characters have come into contact with Anthony Carmichael, the gifted but undeniably decadent playwright. Unbeknownst to them, and the world at large, Carmichael, whilst recovering from a recent nervous breakdown (caused by a series of theatrical disasters almost leading to financial ruin) obtained and read one of the few extant copies of a play called "The King in Yellow".

User summary:

A Call of Cthulhu tournament in two acts, originally run at Arcanacon VI, July 7th - 10th 1988, Melbourne, Australia.

190515.name: Iron Dukes

videogamehonor.32230: 2008 IGF Awards Best Web Browser Game of the Year Winner

190515.description:
Iron Dukes takes place in a fictionalized version of late 19th century America in which Teddy Roosevelt rides a steam-powered horse and Thomas Edison is the leader of a band of roving warlocks. You play as Professor Thurlow Magoon, renowned scientist and greedy treasure hunter.

Source: The Developer Website.

190516.name: Tri-Achnid

videogamehonor.32231: 2008 IGF Awards Best Web Browser Game of the Year Nominee

190516.description:
Play as an endangered species of exopod on the verge of extinction. In search of a safe haven for his young, the tri-achnid must fight his way out of the lithic alps by any means necessary.

Source: The Game Website.

190517.name: Temple in the Ice
190517.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure takes place after the events detailed in c.f. "Pines and Sunshine." It is set in Antarctica in 2000, but can be modified for other times and suitable cold places.

User summary:

Originally published in 1993, this module was revised in 1999 and again revised in 2000.

190518.name: The Bet
190518.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure seems to be ideal chance for some easy cash. All the investigators have to do is stay the night in a haunted house. While the players might think they will be in for an easy time, they will (of course) face horror. The Keeper should imply that the adventure is designed to give the investigators some easy money and a chance to have a little fun exposing a fake haunted house.

User summary:

The scenario presents two alternative approaches to the adventure.

190519.name: The Horror on Two Forks Trail
190519.description:
From the introduction:

This scenario is well suited for all players (and characters) of Call of Cthulhu - no matter their experience, whether they are new and have no prior experience, or are old hands who can outstare a Shoggoth. No special skills or knowledge are required for its successful conclusion and no real time frame is set for the scenario, so events move according to the pace of the keeper, though things should ultimately move along regardless.

User summary:

The scenario is essentially free-form, presenting a situation to which the investigators may respond.

190520.name: Pocket Odyssey Collector's Edition
190520.description:
From the publisher:
In Pocket Odyssey players assume the roles of legendary heroes embarking on epic quests, defeating monsters, finding loot and pretty much anything the players mind can imagine. One of the players is chosen at the beginning of the game to be “the storyteller”, they use innovative quest building cards to help them create a quest for the other players on the fly. Each of the other players assume the role of a single hero, they get to create who that hero is and then how that hero interacts in the storytellers world.

Pocket Odyssey is designed to be portable, the first micro RPG ever, measuring 1in. thick, 3.5in. tall and 5.5in. wide, this game will quite literally fit in your pocket (the Collector's Edition is in a larger box). Pocket Odyssey has been designed for board game players of all backgrounds to pick up and play. Ever been curious about what a role playing game is, but were too intimidated by all the rules? Maybe you have played role playing games before, but don’t have the time to commit to a huge campaign anymore. Just want an engaging and fun fantasy game? Pocket Odyssey is what you have been waiting for.

Gameplay Features


2-4 players (5-6 w/ expansion)
90-120 minutes play time
A tabletop RPG hybrid! No pen or paper needed!
Innovative "on the spot" quest creation method allows for anyone to play as the Game Master. No prep needed!
Focused rules keep the game moving quickly and bring the most fun parts of traditional RPG's into the limelight!


Core game components:
Rule Book
3 Stat Cards
6 Background Cards
16 Personal Goal Cards
20 Item Shards
9 Power Cards
11 Potion Cards
20 Flaw Cards
12 Wooden Pawns
1d6
9 Baddie Stat Cards
40 Counters Shards
10 Action Shards
24 Map Tiles (double sided)
18 Quest Cards
12 Baddy Cards

PLUS:

Large "Box of Holding"
Rule Book
2 Stat Cards
6 Background Cards
9 Power Cards
20 Item Shards
8 Wooden Pawns
6 Baddy Cards
40 Counters Shards
24 Magic Items Cards
25 Hidden Power Cards
24 Baddy Cards
10 Tide of Battle Cards

190521.name: Medieval Brewery
190521.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 32 x 30 inch, full color battlemap of a Medieval Brewery.

The Product comes with the Square, Hex and No Overlay versions and the Virtual Tabletop Maps (VTT).

“If Godric’s latest batch of ale is as good as last years, you are about to be very satisfied customers.”—Tavernkeeper Aidyn

Medieval Brewery is a single level map of the interior of the brewpub and the exterior surroundings on a flat terrain of grass and dirt paths.

Medieval Brewery is intended for use in fantasy or medieval historical era settings.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Bad Batch: Today is the day of the release of Godric’s new ale. The day has such fanfare that a holiday has been proclaimed in the city of Estenix for the following day.

When Tavernkeeper Aidyn taps the first barrel of ale and gives his first customer a drink, he gulps it down. His face contorts in confusion at the taste and then he clutches at his stomach, before falling over dead.

The bar erupts into a bar fight as the man’s friends try to kill Tavernkeeper Aidyn for poisoning him as the Tavernkeeper protests his innocence. The group can choose to intervene or not.

If they don’t stop them, the Tavernkeeper is slain and they tap the next barrel of the new ale. This has the same result on the first imbiber as before. Clearly the Tavernkeeper was not the killer; the ale itself has been poisoned!

Screaming that the ale is tainted, the mob runs into the streets to go to other taverns to try and save others opening the new ale barrels.

The group can help them or go to investigate Godric’s brewery on the other side…

190522.name: 40 Adventures for Call of Cthulhu
190522.description:
User summary:

This web-published document contains forty separate adventures for the Call of Cthulhu game. Several of the adventures form series of two or three scenarios. All of the included adventures were previously published as stand-alone documents. The substantial compilation was initially published in 1998 and subsequently expanded and re-published in 2002.

190523.name: CATS: a sad but necessary cycle of violent predatory behavior
190523.description:
This may look like a kid's game, but the experience is much more geared for teens and adults looking for a light, fun programming game.

Cats all start with the same cards: (Catch, Stalk, Play, Steal, Taunt, and Eat). No luck of the draw here, it's entirely up to you! Get as many enjoyment points as possible and win the game! Plan and anticipate what the others will do so that you can claim birds from the backyard or from other cats.

Each player targets another cat and a bird. They will then select their actions for the two rounds of play. All of the cards are revealed simultaneously, the actions are resolved and when the smoke clears, some cats may have birds and some may not.

The birds will hang out at the bird bath, in the grass, on the fence or in the trees. The bigger birds will need to be stalked before catching them and you will have to time everything just right. Once you do catch your bird you will have a choice to either press your luck and play with the bird to double its enjoyment point value or to just eat it. The longer you play with it, the greater the chance of it being stolen by another cat.

Taunt cards allow other cats to distract you and cancel your actions. Nothing is safe in this backyard!

A basic rules set is included for younger players and beginners.

190524.name: Prospector's Game
190524.description: A dice-based game where you try to advance your pawn to the winning space by rolling 10's, 11's, and 12's. It seems to be a thinly-disguised gambling game.

190525.description:
Streets of Regalis is a campaign setting for In Harm's Way Tactics, the turn-based tactical combat game. In a massive expansion of the original game, Streets of Regalis introduces players to the capital city of the Imperium, including three separate districts with distinct missions and factions. With this new campaign, characters can enjoy hours of gameplay in the Imperium Chronicles universe.

(Disclaimer: Not affiliated with the In Harm's Way line of RPGs published by Flying Mice Games.)
190525.name: Imperium Chronicles: In Harm's Way Tactics – Streets of Regalis

169815.name: Imperium Chronicles: In Harm's Way Tactics

190526.name: The Last Prayer of the Dying
190526.description:
From the front cover of the "Kickstarter Release Version:"

A 5th edition adventure module

This adventure is for 4-6 1st level PCs

The party are travelling to the new frontier to help return an ancient Duchy to its former glory. A chance encounter with the legendary 'Arisen Knight', a very old hero, sets them on a path to adventure.

190527.name: CitiesUP
190527.description:
Welcome to CitiesUP!
County officials just offered new opportunities for land purchases, and you are now an official investor for a new city. Build, develop, and increase your income.
Your job is simple: outperform all the other investors in the game. But don ́t be a shark! And remember the little people: the inhabitants of your new city need services to be satisfied!
Let ́s build this city!

CitiesUP is a 2-4 player board game. Every player acts like an investor. Build residential, commercial, bank, farm, or industrial buildings, and then supply them with electricity, water, and services.
Every player collects tax revenue from their buildings, which each have to be supplied with different services to thrive.
Your goal: purchase as many buildings as possible and supply them with water, electricity, and services to reach a higher score than the other players. Buildings have to be supplied properly to generate taxes for the owner. Taxes, bonuses, and upkeep each generate points for the owner. When the last demand card is turned face-up, the round is complete and the game is over.
If two players have the same amount of points, the tie will be broken by counting each player's money tokens.

190528.name: Legacy at Sea
190528.description:
Unemployment is high. European oversight is sparse. Merchant vessels are transporting lucrative goods through the Caribbean. The conditions are set for the Golden Age of Piracy. Given few options, many chose a life of plunder and strife. But alas, life aboard a sailing ship is anything but easy. Cramped quarters, storms, rats and infested food, most will be lucky to survive. A few may even find fortune. Be skilled and your name may live on in history.

Features of Legacy at Sea


Actions are resolved by sector, not by player – Commanders stay involved in the game. No long pauses between turns.
Upgrade your ships – You will command three ships. You may add cannon, crew, officers, and specialists.
Key Event Cards – Each card adds a story element of the game. Your choices will affect your reputation and how the foreign powers view you.
7 Victory Conditions – (Wealth, Guile, Ruthlessness, Spanish Hero, English Hero, Captain objective, Secret Back Story objective).


Players will control 3 ships in their armada. Each round they will choose one of four actions. Sail/Explore, Plunder, Attack, Repair. Larger Merchant Ships and Treasure Ships will be heavily defended and more difficult to take. Do you risk it or attempt to build up your reputation by picking off smaller ships?
This is a medium level difficulty game. Giving you a representative experience without bogging you down in details. However, the choices you make and lady luck will determine which pirates will ultimately prevail.

190529.description:
In Ghost Hunter: Monsters players become Infernal Club investigators engaged in a cryptozoological big-game hunt. The Club members are spread across the globe chasing the beasts of world folklore. Pride is at stake and the title of ‘Master of the Hunt’ will go to the biggest catch of the season.

This is a card game for 2-6 players that should last for 10 – 30 minutes. Players take turns laying higher and higher cards on a central stack. If a player can’t lay an equal or higher card on a stack then they must pick up the stack. If a player lays a set or run of 3 cards at once then they get to capture the stack. The first player to play all of their cards ends the game. Players count up the scores of all of the cards they have captured minus all of the cards they didn’t manage to get rid of. The player with the highest score wins the game.

Ghost Hunter: Monsters is a standalone game but it is also one of a series of compatible Ghost Hunter decks. You may take cards from any of these decks and shuffle them together to create new and interesting versions of the game.
190529.name: Ghost Hunter: Monsters

190530.description:
A compilation item containing both Munchkin Fu and Munchkin Fu 2: Mönche mögens heiß in a metal box.

Contains:

1 Instructions
1 Dice white with black dots (no Munchkinhead)
1 Munchkin Fu level counter
280 Cards (including 2 blank Cards)
190530.name: Munchkin Fu

190531.name: Hadean Lands
190531.description:
Marooned in an alien, airless wasteland — your starship fractured — your crewmates missing. Can an apprentice alchemist learn how to survive?

Repairing an alchemical starship single-handed? Not easy; perhaps impossible. You’ll have to discover the rituals you need, and then search for ingredients, and then improvise and substitute. You’ll have to calcine, distill, dissolve, and precipitate. And somehow, somewhere, you’ll have to figure out what happened and why.

Source: The Game Website.

190533.name: Synaesthete
190533.description:
Move your character from room to room, eliminating enemies to the sequence of falling notes and the rhythm of the beat in this classic arcade shooter with pulse-pounding musical gameplay.

Source: The Developer Website.

190534.name: Tag: The Power of Paint
190534.description:
The world is your canvas in this innovative first-person puzzle platformer. Tag walls and other surfaces with different colors of spray paint to reveal new ways to navigate each level, including bouncing off, sliding across, and sticking to the surfaces you paint.

Source: The Developer Website.

190535.name: Rooms (2014)
190535.description:
User summary:

In Rooms, players' characters are asleep and experiencing a shared dream. All action takes place within this dream. Atypically, character creation is not performed prior to the game but during play as the characters aspects are revealed by shifting dreamscapes.

190537.name: Sins of Seattle
190537.description:
A Kickstarter and convention-exclusive Catalyst campaign.

From the campaign guide text:

“Sins of Seattle” takes place in and around the Seattle-metropolitan area. The players try to prepare the town for an imminent demon assault; navigating the various human factions vying for power, resources, and other, more sinister, goals.

From a Cherry Picked Games design post:

The Catalyst campaign, “Sins of Seattle”, draws upon Christian morality and apocalypse lore to form characters. The demons are an ever-present threat, but players must contend with humans behaving with reckless self-interest, misguided altruism, and profound apathy. The goal is to have the players muddle through a moral grey-area at they evaluate they own priorities and ethics.

190538.name: Last Half of Darkness: Tomb of Zojir
190538.description:
The darkness has descended upon Louisiana, where the treasures from the gypsy's lair are still hidden, when a mysterious book is found in the tiny town of Shadowcrest. Perhaps a book that should never have been opened. A book with pages that chart the passage to the Isle of the Dead...

Shrouded among fog and lore, legends of the Island speak of the strange ghosts that live there and the creatures of the dead hiding in the shadows; feeding on sailors foolish enough to beach upon the dark shores. Although stories of great treasure surround the island, it is also rumored that the isle holds the origin for a great darkness inside an ancient temple built centuries ago.

Source: The Publisher Website.

190540.name: The Bleeding Mind
190540.description:
From publisher blurb:

The psychic rules expansion for Big Damn Dryden 2503 is here. Add the spice of telepathy and madness to your Big Damn Dryden game. Included are the full suit of psychic paths and skins as well as new corporations, psychic armoury, animal control rules, and the deadliest NPCs to date.

Included free with this version is a fully playable scenario set in the dangrous Tian Jin system. Who will you play? What organization will you work for?

If it meant you could have powers beyond human understanding, would you be willing to risk the Bleeding Mind?

190541.name: Tokyo Ghoul: Jail
190541.description:
User Summary

Once, the ghoul Jail committed the crime of mass-killing investigators. But there were few eye witnesses, and no one knew his true appearance. The young ghoul Rio, as one of the suspects of the Jail incident, was thought to be responsible and was imprisoned in Cochlea.

190542.name: Phantasy Star Nova

videogamehonor.37485: 2014 Japan Game Awards Best Unreleased Game Winner

190542.description:
As part of the Arks Special Planetary Exploration Group Alter, the player is on a journey to return alive from Machia, a chaotic planet where photons have no effect, after the Delta Valiant warship crashes on Machia with 1,000 crew on board. The planet also happens to be home to the Gigantes, who are hostile foes. On the planet exists another source of energy known as Gran, and by substituting it as an energy source in place of photons, technology such as weapons can be used.

Source: Wikipedia, "Phantasy Star Nova", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190543.name: Assault Suit Leynos (2015)
190543.description: Assault Suit Leynos is a remake of the 1990 Mega Drive game Assault Suit Leynos (released as Target Earth in the US). The game is utilizing “open development,” taking public opinion into account at all times.

190544.name: Frizzy
190544.description:
Frizzy is a platformer filled with awesome action. The main plot is that you are a frizzy ball of fur who can latch onto static balls launch himself around the levels.

The most important thing about Frizzy’s gameplay, to us, is the way the controls feel. We believe that in a platformer the controls must be absolutely perfect.

The gameplay is based on solving puzzles. You’ll find locked doors, crazy enemies, wacky obstacles, destroyable boxes and more.

Source: The Developer Website.

190545.name: Squad
190545.description:
Squad is the long-anticipated standalone spiritual successor to the massively popular BF2:Project Reality Mod, winner of the ModDB.com MoTY Award. Gather your mates and rally up for the Massive Squad-based 100 man Combined Arms Warfare featuring decade-honed balance between realism and FPS gameplay.

Features

Gameplay faster and more fluid than ARMA but slower and more engaging than Battlefield.
Teamwork oriented gameplay that doesn't require a clan or private server to fully realize the potential of the gameplay.
Built in Voice Over IP using the best codecs available, with attenuated localized, intra-squad radio, and inter-squad command radio communications.
Showcase Deployables and Base Building which no other military FPS has.
The creation, defense, destruction and resupply of chained spawn positions in an overlapping and always fluid emergent chessboard designed in our maps.
Large scale maps up to 8km^2. (currently working with 2km and 4km maps)
High quality models and complex animations systems.
Essentially an "everything" game. Infantry/Logistics/Air Combat/CAS/Armor Warfare

Source: The Publisher Website.

190546.name: Hurtworld
190546.description:
Hurtworld is a hardcore multiplayer survival FPS with a focus on deep survival progression that doesn't become trivial once you establish some basic needs. That feeling when you're freezing to death trying to make a fire, or you're defenceless being chased by Creatures. These experiences are what make a survival game. When you overcome that challenge and find a level of comfort it's a great feeling, but what do you do next? Hurtworld tempts you out of your comfort zone with rich Resources, better Loot and higher Tech. It will also throw more dangerous creatures, harsher Environments and new challenges at you that can't be taken on without the proper Gear or refined skill. Will you settle for Bows and Arrows and a Campfire, or push deeper into the map and start scavenging for Vehicle Parts and better Weapons?

Built from the ground up with solid multiplayer foundations. Designed for fast skill based PVP and PVE. You will constantly have to decide which is the biggest threat, the player opposite you or the creatures that will hear your gunshot. Battle Hunger, Cold, Heat, and the dangerous environment around you. Tame your surroundings, Build a base, explore your world. But the biggest threat out there is other players. Create alliances, and destroy your enemies. Targeted towards hardcore gamers, Hurtworld aims to punish.

Source: The Game Website.

190547.name: The Mean Greens
190547.description:
Take part in history's greatest battle of Green Vs. Tan. Fight amongst and against others online. Jump, shoot, and roll your way to victory with fast, objective based gameplay.

Features

10 larger than life environments
10 objective based battles
Batteries not included

Source: The Game Website.

190548.description:
The Vampires team has won the HELVETIA Cup many times before. Strongly hierarchical and deceptively strong, the Vampires are not that tough, but they should be approached with caution.
Their motto: "One for all and all for me!"
In this box, you’ll find the necessary to play the Vampires Team: 9 pre-painted miniatures, Player Cards, POWER Cards, …
190548.name: Helvetia Cup: the Vampires

190549.name: Waning Crescent, Shattered Cross
190549.description:
Following the fall of Rhodes, the Knights of St John rewarded Suleiman’s magnanimity by harassing Turkish shipping and commerce from their new home in Malta. In 1565, Suleiman sent his generals to finish the task he had left incomplete more than 40 years previously. The Turks laid siege with a force that reached 60,000 in number. They would exterminate the 500 Knights of St John defending the island and wipe the Order from the face of the earth – or so they thought. If ever there was an ‘against the odds’ situation then this was surely it.

Waning Crescent, Shattered Cross (WCSC) recreates the incredible events that occurred on this small Mediterranean island and changed the course of European history. Using cards to drive events, WCSC is a relatively quick playing, moderate complexity simulation. Players must decide whether to try to build their hands to a size that might deliver a decisive blow or to use their cards to gradually wear down their opponent. And the play of cards complements the management of resource including supply, artillery, men and even honour. Acts of treachery, torture and atrocities will contrast starkly with acts of heroism, rousing speeches and even the celebration of Saints Days in the midst of horror and terror.

Along with the full 2-player campaign scenario, there is also a short/learning scenario and a 'bot' controlled solitaire variant.

190550.description: This mini expansion introduces feedbags, which you can use to increase the value of a Herd when you sell it.
190550.name: El Gaucho: Fodder for the Cattle

190551.description:
Carcassonne: Winter-Edition: Die Kornkreise – which is playable only with the Winter-Edition of Carcassonne – consists of six new tiles and rules. A corn circle tile allows a player to place a second follower on a feature that they have already-claimed or return an already-placed follower back to his supply.

Carcassonne: Winter-Edition: Die Kornkreise debuted as a promotional item at Essen 2015.
190551.name: Carcassonne: Winter-Edition – Die Kornkreise

190552.name: Kuddelmuddel Schnupperspiel
190552.description:
There's a big mess on the table! Who can clean up the cards the fastest, while also lining up cards that match one another?

In Kuddelmuddel – German for "hodgepodge" – players try to put together chains of cards in order to score points. To set up the game, the players scatter the 80 cards in the deck face down on the table and place the bell within reach of all players. Everyone then simultaneously starts looking at face-down cards one by one. You can place the first card you see face up to start a row in front of you. To place another card next to this first one, whether on the left or right, the newly placed card must have at least one image in common with the card already in place.

As soon as a player has seven matching cards in a row, she rings the bell. If she goofed up, she sits out the round until another player creates a row; if she did everything correctly, she scoops up those cards and places them in a pile beside her while all other players reshuffle their cards into those that remain on the table.

The game ends whenever the last card is taken from the center of the table. Whoever has collected the most cards (i.e., rows) wins!

---

This is a small, promotional edition of Kuddelmuddel containing 32 "cards" to cut out yourself.

190553.description: Includes both the original Munchkin game – albeit the revised 2011 edition with color cards and updated text – and Munchkin 2: Unnatural Axe.
190553.name: Munchkin 1+2

190554.name: Chaos Reborn

videogamehonor.35952: 2016 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Nominee

190554.description:
User Summary

A turn-based tactical combat between two or more wizards that use cards to summon spells, minions or conjurations to beat their opponent.

The Game relies on probability management with bluffing elements making it a nice chess-like and poker-esk Game as the players have to use tactical movement and terrain and their risk.

Its a remake of an old 1985 classic "Chaos".

190556.name: Football Manager 2016

videogamehonor.35010: 2015 Global Game Awards Best Management Game of the Year Nominee

190556.description:
Football Manager is the most realistic, in-depth and immersive football management simulation available – it’s the closest thing to doing the job for real.

Taking control of any squad from more than 50 countries across the world, you decide who plays and who sits on the bench, deal with the media and solve player problems.

You're in total control of tactics, team-talks, substitutions and pitch-side instructions as you follow the match live with the acclaimed 3D match engine.

Source: The Game Website.

190557.name: RWBY: Grimm Eclipse
190557.description:
Get ready for intense combat action as you battle Grimm across familiar locations of Remnant including new areas never before seen in the show. Play as Ruby, Weiss, Blake, and Yang in this character-driven adventure that explores new storylines, new Grimm types, and a new villain!

The gameplay takes inspiration from Dynasty Warriors and Left 4 Dead offering over-the-top combat along with engaging missions and storytelling.

GAME FEATURES:
Online Co-op Multiplayer
4 playable characters with unique skill trees
Full story campaign with a NEW storyline
MOBA-like leveling during gameplay
Several locations from the world of Remnant
NEW locations never before seen in the show
NEW enemy types
NEW villain
Loads of unlocks, achievements, and rewards

Source: The Game Website.

190558.description:
From the publisher:

BATLHEX (pronounced bat'l-heks) is a novel strategy board game played by two opponents who battle against one another with game pieces on a hexagonal board. To win a player must be the first to capture all of the opponent's pieces. Each player’s ability to move or return a piece to the board is determined by rolling a die. This highly replayable game, which features a game board, die, twelve game pieces, and a rule sheet, incorporates a unique method of play that makes the game both easy to learn by the youngest players and a challenge for mature gamers. (Level: Beginner-Intermediate)

BATLHEX Commander is a variation of the basic game that removes the die and adds a Commander piece to both sides. The object is to capture the opponent's Commander first. All of the pieces (with the exception of the Commander) share the same unique movement capability, and both player's have a chance to bring a captured piece back during a turn if they occupy a certain hex. BATLHEX Commander allows both players to think several turns ahead and develop various long-term strategies. (Level: Intermediate-Advanced)
190558.name: BATLHEX

190559.name: CLANNAD

videogamehonor.33987: 2015 Operation Rainfall Awards Best PC Game of the Year Winner

190559.description:
The story follows the life of Tomoya Okazaki. In the first story arc, called School Life, he is a high school delinquent who meets many people in his last year at school, including five girls, and helps resolve their individual problems. The second story arc, called After Story, follows his life as an adult after graduating from school. The gameplay of Clannad follows a branching plot line which offers a number of alternate scenarios with dialogue choices and courses of interaction, focusing on the player character's interactions with various non-player characters.

Source: Wikipedia, "Clannad (visual novel)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190560.name: Star Wars Rebels: Spark of Rebellion

rpg.19360: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire

190560.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A long time ago in a galaxy far, far away....

In the Age of the Empire, the iron grip of Emperor Palpatine's new order has brought peace and order to a Galaxy reeling from the Clone Wars. That it has done so by oppression, control and increasingly brutal enforcement of its ideals has caused a growing number of people, initially in isolated pockets of resistance, to fight back. Some call them terrorists. We call them Rebels...

Step onto the planet Lothal with Star Wars Rebels: Spark Of Rebellion, an unofficial fan-created sourcebook for the Star Wars Rebels TV show. This book contains background on the setting of the show, as well as its heroes, its villains, the equipment they use and the places they visit. Have a drink at Old Jho's Pitstop, or compete in violent illegal gladiatorial events. But whatever you do, wherever you go, watch out for the Empire.

This sourcebook includes:

• A detailed section describing several locales on Lothal
• Two new player species options
• Weapons, armor, gear, and starships
• Five ready to play modular encounters

190561.name: Sakura Santa
190561.description:
User Summary

Sakura Santa is a visual novel about a s boy named Koji who makes a wish to have someone to spend time with around Christmas, and soon meets three unusual girls.

190562.name: Who's Your Daddy

videogamehonor.39267: 2016 Global Game Awards Best Comedy Game of the Year Nominee

190562.description:
User Summary

Who's Your Daddy features a clueless father attempting to prevent his infant son from certain death.

190563.name: Order of Invention
190563.description:
A deck of Invention cards have a picture and the name of the invention on one side and the year it was invented on the other. Four Invention cards are placed on the table with the year face down. Each player has four player chips with first, second, third and fourth in them. Players place their chips face down next to the Invention cards to indicate the order they think those 4 cards were invented. For each chip placed next to the correct invention card, players receive a point. Whoever has the highest score after 5 rounds, wins!

The Invention Deck has one Invention per year with no duplicate years. They include a wide variety of inventions all within the 1900's. Inventions are easily recognizable but just obscure enough that each game will be a challenge!

190566.description:
This is a promotional playable character for the Krosmaster series of games, released at PAX 2015.

This character has his name in red, which indicates that he is only meant for fun and non-competitive play. He won't be legal in tournament, and won't be available in the online version of the game.
190566.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Nemesis Samurai

190567.description: This is a promotional playable character for the Krosmaster series of games, first released at PAX 2015.
190567.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Joris - Master

190568.description: This is a promotional playable character for the Krosmaster series of games, first released at PAX 2015.
190568.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Grougaloragran - Old

190569.description: This is a promotional playable character for the Krosmaster series of games, first released at PAX 2015.
190569.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Grampy - Shopkeeper

190570.description:
This is a promotional playable character for the Krosmaster series of games, released at PAX 2015.

This character has his name in red, which indicates that he is only meant for fun and non-competitive play. He won't be legal in tournament, and won't be available in the online version of the game.
190570.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Cardboard Tube Samurai

190571.name: Resilience: Wave Survival
190571.description:
User Summary

Set in an abandoned village, being taken over by alien invaders & zombies.

190572.name: 1941: Race to Moscow
190572.description:
Have you heard about the Barbarossa campaign?
Logistic was the key to either failure or success.

Take command of one of the three German Army groups and advance towards Moscow!

The game is based on the system used in 1944: Race to the Rhine, but the gameplay is much more deeper. Armies are divided into armored and non-motorized, transports compose of trucks and trains.
And the enemy - Soviets is terribly strong.

190573.name: Koromo Lean Management Game
190573.description:
Koromo Japanese workshop
Japanese workshop is an educational game of Lean Management. Players take on the role of the owner of the garage, which is still working to bring the greatest gains. The game allows you to familiarize yourself with concepts such as efficiency, quality and continuous improvement.
In each round, players perform moves in two rounds. In the first round followed by perfecting his workshop in three categories (quality, productivity, order). Such an action requires an adequate number of points of knowledge from the player. Points knowledge obtained at the beginning of the game and wins throughout its duration. In the second round, each player receives one car repair order, which is placed on the player board (workshop). The player uses their moves (moving pawns) to repair the damaged car best. The game ends when one player accumulates the appropriate number of experience points (20). Experience points are awarded for the improvement actions and repaired cars.

190574.name: 7th Dragon 2020-II
190574.description:
User Summary

7th Dragon 2020-II is the sequel to 7th Dragon 2020. The game also features a new idol class.

190575.name: 7th Dragon III Code: VFD

videogamehonor.39873: 2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Nintendo Exclusive Game of the Year Nominee

190575.description:
User Summary

7th Dragon III Code: VFD, takes place in the year 2100 and follows the story of the Nodens Corporation's attempt to complete the Dragon Chronicle in time to save humanity from the awakening of the titular seventh Divine Dragon, an event that will almost certainly spell doom for the human race.

190576.name: Chronicles System
190576.description:
User summary:

Chronicles System is a major implementation of a generic, universal tabletop role-playing game. It was published as an extensive series of well-developed web pages that were freely available online. The core system was presented as major web pages, each with sub-pages, including:

01.0: Character Creation
02.0: Traits: Merits and Flaws
03.0: Skills
03.1: Skills: Combat Masteries
04.0: Basic Rules: Definitions
05.0: Arms and Equipment
05.1: Melee Weapons
05.2: Ranged Weapons
05.3: Armor
06.0: Basic Rules: The Chronicles System
07.0: Combat Rules: Basics
07.1: Combat Rules: Defense
07.2: Combat Rules: Offense
07.3: Combat Rules: Unarmed
07.4: Combat Rules: Advanced
07.5: Combat Rules: Firearms
08.0: Health and Damage
09.0: Experience
09.1: Downtime Character Growth
10.0: Heroic Characteristics

The game is surprisingly robust and balanced for a free product. Version 1 was developed for in-house play through about 2000. In 2002 the author copyrighted Version 2 of the system. In 2005 the author published Version 3 (the only published Version) on the internet as HTML pages. This version went through continuous minor development until 2008 when the game unfortunately went offline.

190577.name: Get Adler! Deduction Card Game
190577.description:
London, 1937 — Intelligence has discovered that Top-Secret documents are missing. So, too, is MI6 Agent Adler. The only clue is an intercepted message: "Trafalgar at seven." MI5 Agent Gold, Inspector Sharpe of Scotland Yard, and Constable Townsend have been thrown this task: "Find and eliminate Adler." They've got seven hours.

Get Adler! is a social deduction card game in which secret characters investigate each other to unmask Adler. Once the traitor is revealed, the game transforms into an action-packed race against time to eliminate Adler and to recover Top-Secret documents.

190579.name: Roguelands
190579.description:
User Summary

Roguelands is an action platform-RPG. You play as a Galactic Cadet, and you and up to three friends explore hostile worlds, slay dangerous creatures and collect loot.

190580.name: 12 is Better Than 6
190580.description:
User Summary

12 is better than 6 is a top-down shooter with a Western theme and hand-drawn artwork.

boardgameimplementation.224686: Twilight Struggle Turn Zero and Promo Packs

boardgamecompilation.224686: Twilight Struggle Turn Zero and Promo Packs

190581.description:
These 8 cards were included as promo decks #1 and #2 with the Twilight Struggle digital Kickstarter. It comprises of 4 card sheets with descriptions of the cards on them, an alternate Space Race Track board, a special Zaire counter to be used on the board if the "Mobutu Sese Seko" event card is activated, and 8 cards:

Non-Aligned Movement
Mobutu Sese Seko
Berlin Wall
Stanislav Petrov
Who Lost China?
"Don't Wait for the Translation"
"Kremlin Flu"
"First Lightning"
190581.name: Twilight Struggle: Promo Deck

190582.name: Best Friend S
190582.description:
Best Friend S is a party game.

Guess my favorite travel destination!
Ask a question to the other players.
As an answerer, come up with something that will please the giver.
Show that you "care" and understand the giver to win the place of BEST FRIEND!

100 question cards included.
For example, "Guess my best answer for what I'd want to do on my last day on earth", or "Guess my best answer for what I was in my previous life".

Including new infinitely-rewritable "Pixel slates" & Special pens, so players do not have to prepare writing materials.

190583.name: Lady Satan 1944
190583.description:
From publisher blurb:

"I'll answer the invitation to death... but not with bullets."

When everyone she loved was killed in a Nazi bombing raid, a young woman surrendered her entire existence to a quest for revenge. Under the name Lady Satan, she first hunted and killed the Nazis whereever she could with conventiional weapons... but later, she became a master of black magic. Even after the Nazi monsters were broken and consigned to history, she continued her fight, becoming a hunter of all manner of supernatural monsters.

Lady Satan 1944 presents four illustrrated tales of the mysterious Lady Satan--two from her career as a traditional spy and assasin, and two from her existence as a creature-killing sorceress. The book also contains a short story by Steve Miller (who has written fiction for Dragonlance and Star Wars) that reveals how she gained access to magic, and OGL d20 Modern rules that allows for the incorporation of the spirit-powered magic of Lady Satan in campaigns where magic is supposed to be rare or non-existent.

190584.name: The Diocesan (Hybrid Class)
190584.description:
From publisher blurb:

In honor of the Winter Solstice and seasonal holiday, a special December issue of Player Paraphernalia brings you the Diocesan. The Dio-what? The Diocesan, a hybrid class that joins the arcane and spontaneous casting of the sorcerer with the channel energy and domains of the cleric. Although a relatively short class as far as word count, this hybrid packs a punch being able to handle many situations that call for an arcane spell caster while gaining domain spells to the caster's list of known spells, doubling the additional number of spells gained from the additional character class abilities.

190585.name: The Ice Queen's Palace
190585.description:
From publisher blurb:

Winter has always been a season feared by people. Biting winds, freezing temperatures and thick ice make life difficult, and can also end life. People cling to their warmth during the cold seasons, huddled around their fires. This is part of what makes the Ice Queen so different. She is the winter. She is the cold. In her frozen palace, built from the living ice, she sits and plans. Beware an invitation from the Ice Queen - it may be hard to resist.

The Ice Queen's Palace is a set of printable dungeon floorplans compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

The Ice Queen's Palace is a multiple level set, comprising 8 battlemaps (each depicting a different floor)

Sublevel 1 - Carved out of the ice, the lowest level of the Ice Palace contains prison cells, store rooms and guard rooms for the few soldiers and creatures that work for the Ice Queen.
Sublevel 2 Directly beneath the palace, this level houses some stores and prisons, but also barrack rooms for the soldiers and servants of the Ice Palace
Ground Floor- Growing from the solid frozen ground, the ground floor of the palace features an entrance hall, a hall of statues, and then a grand throne room.
First Floor - Accessed by spiral stairs, the first floor has a banquet hall, ballroom and reading room.
Second Floor - On this level is an audience room, the treasury and the resting place of a magic ice staff
Third Floor - This smaller level has two bedrooms, for those guests invited to stay a while.
Fourth Floor - This floor is where the Ice Queen casts her powerful elemental magic
Fifth Floor - The highest level of the tower is where the Ice Queen sleeps, in a grand bed

190586.name: UnSummoning: The Spectral Horde
190586.description:
Once upon a time, a nefarious necromancer summoned an army of vengeful spirits to wreak havoc upon the world. Unfortunately, they only wanted to wreak havoc upon HIM! Now he must undo what he has done by drawing upon the power of magic sigils to blast the ghouls back to the netherworld. Featuring an innovative mix of color matching puzzle mechanics and fast-paced, twin stick shooter action.

Source: The Developer Website.

190587.name: The Madness of Little Emma
190587.description:
Madness of Little Emma is a roguelike platformer inspired by games such as Castlevania, Legend of Zelda, American McGee's Alice, Binding of Isaac. Help Emma find her brother who has disappeared in eerie cirumstances.

The game is a procedurally generated platformer where the player, controlling the title Emma has to dive deep into her basement to find her lost brother.

On her way Emma will find various items which will affect her abilities and strengths granting such effects as heat aura burning adjacent enemies, bouncing bullets, double jump, laser bullets, protective shields, friendly minions and much more. Collecting power ups has a downside as picking up items results in Emma slowly going insane which is reflected by the types of monsters that are encountered - the player is supposed to find the balance between picking up items and not losing sanity too fast. On the way Emma can meet over 50 unique types of 'ordinary' monsters and almost 20 different bosses each with different attacks and powers.

The game will have an online ladder for anyone who wants to compete and compare his results to others.

Game will be released on Steam in december 2015 on Windows, Linux and Mac.

Source: The Developer Website.

190588.name: Moonshot
190588.description:
Physics based tank death game.

Source: The Developer Website.

190589.name: Lightrise
190589.description:
"What is this game all about?"

It's about combat! The vision is to create an immensely fun, competitive, skillful and, at times, infuriating game of combat.

From a design standpoint, I want to keep the game focused, performance-minded and minimalistic at heart - so it can do what it does as well as it can.

A very general list of hopes for the game are as follows...

a game where..
...there are no builds, classes, choices or restrictions aside from ones self-imposed.
...practice makes perfect, and competition is fierce - even among friends!
...a player's ability won't be limited by the number of abilities they can chose.
...not only high skill and precision players are rewarded, but also smart and intuitive ones.
...players are not bombarded with unnecessary and over-complicated game mechanics.
...emphasis is on combat first and foremost.
...every victory is as satisfying as every defeat is crushing.

Source: The Developer Website.

rpg.32414: The Legend of Dragoon Storytelling System

190590.name: The Legend of Dragoon Storytelling System (Version 1.1)
190590.description:
User summary:

Characters are built on a model derived from the video game upon which the game is based. Characters have Attributes and Abilities (similar to Skills) and Advantages. These are all supplied with statistics from a standard point matrix. Characters also identify a fighting style, which may depend upon race and background. The combat system is complex and offers numerous special maneuvers and options. The game includes a lengthy items list derived from the video game.

rpg.32414: The Legend of Dragoon Storytelling System

190591.name: The Legend of Dragoon Storytelling System (Version 1.2)
190591.description:
From the introduction:

The game takes place on the continent of Endiness from the original video game. It can take place at any point in history, allowing players to participate in the original Dragon Campaign, or deal with a new threat 100 years after the events of the original game (the Dragoons appear whenever legend needs them). The game was designed to be ideally played with seven players, so that each element is represented. [The rules] assume a certain amount of exposure to both Legend of Dragoon and the [White Wolf] d10 Storyteller System.

User summary:

The Version 1.2 document varies from the Version 1.1 document primarily in refinements such as corrections, improved formatting, and minor additions.

190592.name: The Alchemy System
190592.description:
User summary:

The Alchemy System is a modified D20 system that adds numerous components (Classes, Feats, Skills, etc.) to the base open game content. The game is published as freely accessible HTML pages, which include some (minor) information on a customized "universe" and a "SteamPunk Wild West" setting, including some maps.

The site was last updated in 2008.

190593.description:
Grisa is a mountainous land!
The Ogres are friendly. They have a very strong team spirit but their strength and love of others are often a problem for the opposing team. In fact seeing Ogres gobble up a piece of their opponent is not a rare sight. Before winning, the opponent needs to stay in one piece! "
In this box, you’ll find the necessary to play the Ogres Team :
o 9 pre-painted miniatures, Player Cards, POWER Cards, …

This is an expansion box. It needs the standard HELVETIA Cup box to be played!
190593.name: Helvetia Cup: the Ogres

190594.description:
The box contains :
o 1 miniature cup.
o 2 prepainted miniature stars (the Medusa and the Genius).
o The player, POWER and LEGEND cards in relation to the Stars.
o 4 new goals with a beautiful new design.
o 40 boosts in form of potions.

This is an expansion box. It needs the standard HELVETIA Cup box to be played!
190594.name: Helvetia Cup: DeLuxe Box

190595.description:
In this box, you’ll find the necessary to organize Tournament
The box contains :

A second TOTOMAT.
2 more dice D20.
A time marker.
A memo to record your score and team progress.
A normal game board. At the bottom, you’ll find a tournament desk for the Cup and Tournament. You’ll be able to write progress of the Championship on it with an easily erasable pen.
Number indicator tags, to make the numbers easier to see on the field.
1 more balls.
190595.name: Helvetia Cup: Tournament Box

190597.name: Snipstern
190597.description:
Each player has a set of pawns that start in his or her corner of the board. The goal is to move the pawns around the board to the "home" spaces. Movement is determined by a die. All players move around the board on their own track in the shape of a triangle. All 4 triangles together form a star, so the players may capture each other's pawns at the intersections. Captured pawns are returned to their player's corner and must start their journey over. The winner is the first player to move all pawns "home".

The game was published between 1923 and 1937.

190598.name: La boîte de la langue française
190598.description:
La boîte de la langue française is a game of various questions about French language.

The first edition contains 300 questions and the second edition 500 questions.

190600.name: Minions
190600.description:
32 cards, four of each family (color) that make it possible to play two games:

Action Game:

The object of this game is to get rid of all your cards as soon as possible. Each player gets 5 cards and the rest go in a pile face-down with 1 card turn up next to it. In a player turn he must play a card with the same colour, number or symbol as the face-up next to the draw pile. When a card with a symbol it's played, the action related to that symbol must be performed. Then the next player goes.
When no card can be played, the player must take the top card from the face-down pile. If that card matches it can be played, if not the turn moves for the next player.
You win if get rid of all your cards.

Family Game:

The object of the game is to get the most families of minions you can (4 of each colour makes a family). One player ask for a type of card to any other player. If he can form a family he displays it in front of it and can continue until one player can group all the families he has in his hand at any given moment.
If a player asks a card and the other player does not have it that player's turn ends.

190602.description:
This new specialist card expands the solo game variant.

When you choose Harlekin for a building period, do not shuffle it with the other cards. Put it at the bottom of the shuffled stack instead. Harlekin will always be one of the last two cards from which you can choose one to play for both actions.

His first ability clears all remaining buildings in a row on the central board.

His second ability gives you 3 of a certain resource, determined by rolling a die.

Included in Spielbox 2015/7
190602.name: Die Glasstraße: Harlekin

190603.name: Do My Bidding
190603.description:
Put down your weapons! You fought your battles, now hire heroes for the hard work. Players bid to complete quests and earn rewards.

Each player begins with gold that they use to secretly bid for Heroes to complete their quests. The player with the highest bid wins the Hero's service. Their quest and hero is set aside until the required number of days (turns) pass. The Hero then returns with gold. Journey tokens add twists that may help or hurt players. Play continues around the table with new quests and new heroes. After 10 turns any heroes still out questing come home and all players count their gold to see who is richest!

190604.name: Kust Ma Seda Kuulsin?
190604.description:
The objective of Kust Ma Seda Kuulsin? ("Where did I hear it?") is to guess the quote: which movie, song, novel etc. is it.
Player who guesses correctly moves forward on the game board.
Who finishes first is the winner.

190605.name: Mystery-Dish Diner
190605.description:
From the box:

"A fast-paced guessing game of delicious deduction.

Take turns playing customer and server. As the customer, make three food selections. Place your order by displaying the menu clue cards. Flip the timer! The server rushes to fill the order by using the clues. Ring the bell when the order is correct!

The more food items you serve correctly, the more money you earn! Switch roles and play again!"

This game for young children features cardboard food items, matching clue cards, and a screen to allow the customer to secretly choose three food items. The server can see only the clues (one for each item, describing color, shape, or temperature) and must figure out the customer's order using logic and process of elimination.

190606.name: Battles: Win or Lose
190606.description:
User summary:

Battles: Win or Lose is a well-developed card game incorporating elements of standard table-top role-playing games. Although dice are used, generally speaking the play centers on cards. The play surface is divided into four Zones for each player, called Portal, Umbra, Stage, and Mausoleum. In addition, there is a Rank Slot. Cards are played into Zones with different combinations of abilities being available in each. Many cards represent characters, when active they are called Mobs. Play proceeds in Turns comprising Rounds.

The game typically is distributed as a ZIP archive, with the rule book, some print-and-play components, and a layout document.

190607.name: Super Smash Quest Brawl
190607.description:
User summary:

The setting and several notable non-player characters of Super Smash Quest Brawl are derived from the Nintendo video game. The game system itself is an adaptation of the Exalted D10 flavor of White Wolf's Storytelling System. The game was designed for play over IRC (Internet Relay Chat), though it is not dependent upon that venue (however, most of the game materials, such as the character record sheet, are presented as text-only). Character creation supports a wide variety of characters though the focus is heavily on combat moves and abilities.

The game includes a "Smash Dex" with several entries derived from the video game (e.g., a small Bestiary).

190608.description:
1% is a deckbuilding game where not only are you building your deck collecting point and/or useful card while also trying to take over sites that give you powerful abilities. Collecting three of these sites instantly wins the game so players must be aware, battle opponent's crew, and interact more than your usual deckbuilder.
A drafting mechanic while setting up allows you to customize your gang members prior to play so you feel like you have actually customized your crew from actual strategy and choice.

190610.name: Kalarsys: Core Rulebook (HTML Versions)
190610.description:
User summary:

The Kalarsys: Core Rulebook was made freely available in three versions (0.6.2, 0.7.0, 0.7.1); the differences are minor refinements, though the organization of the 0.7.1 version is improved. Character creation begins with biographical and background information. Characters have "Stats" (Attributes), grouped into Body, Mind, and Skill categories. Body is split into Strength and Vitality; Mind into Intelligence and Willpower; and Skill into Concentration and Dexterity. Points are distributed into these Stats from pools associated with the groups. Derived Stats are then calculated, and then a list of Abilities (special capabilities) are identified.

A version 0.7.2 apparently was developed but not released.

190611.name: Kalarsys Accessories
190611.description:
User summary:

Two versions of the basic character sheet for Kalarsys were provided. One, the most basic, was offered in a GIF graphic format for full-page printing. The second was offered as a more-traditional PDF file; this version featured more options for the evolving system.

A non-player character generator was provided for Kalarsys. This software would randomly generate statistics. It was released as "Version 3" for Unix or DOS; "Version 4" for DOS; and "Version 5" for DOS, with source code. A "Version 6" was developed but (apparently) not released. The generator offered several methods of customization though, reportedly, most did not function as anticipated.

A Kalarsys Dice Roller, or KDice, program was released as a "Version 0.1" for DOS and a "Version 2" for DOS, with source code. For some time the dice roller was also available via a web browser. It was functional, but basic.

190612.name: Kalarsys: Core Rulebook (PDF Version)
190612.description:
User summary:

The Kalarsys rule system has a lengthy development, primarily involving HTML releases. The game has benefited from extensive forum input for several years. In 2015, the rules were presented in PDF format.

The 0.7.5 release in PDF has several appendices which add substantive clarification and details to the rules. The PDF version is also available in MOBI format as well as being available for free online viewing in HTML.

190613.name: The Next Penelope
190613.description:
Set in a futuristic Odyssey, "The Next Penelope" is a fast paced action racing game with loud colors, an original story and a challenging risk-reward system. Weapons can be mixed and used at any time, but all these abilities cost vital energy, so the player is very powerful and close to death at the same time!

As Penelope is looking for Ulysses through the galaxy, the player is free to explore the planets in any order. Each world features unique situations, races, even bosses, and new permanent abilities to enhance the Penelope's spaceship.

Source: The Game Website.

190614.name: Googly Eyes
190614.description:
From the publisher:

Googly Eyes is the hilarious family game that challenges your vision and leaves you googling for more! Put on the zany, vision-altering google eye glasses and start to draw while your team tries to guess what you're drawing. Is that an igloo or a turtle? A birthday cake or a fortress? Players take turns drawing and guessing, so everyone gets a chance to wear the glasses. The glasses come with three sets of lenses that range from mild changes to mind-blowing fun, so no one can see (or draw) straight--your vision will bounce off of the lenses. Googly Eyes is a fun twist on classic drawing games that lets players of different ages and skill levels compete on equal terms, since the goggles make it fun and challenging for everyone. Unlike any other drawing game you don't need to be an artist, and the rules are simple. Just roll the die and move--the space you land on tells you which color lenses to use (easy, medium, or hard). Then pick a card, set the timer, and start drawing. If your team guesses correctly you get to roll and move again; if not, then you stay where you are on the board. The first team to reach Finish wins.

190615.name: Steam: Rails To Riches

videogamehonor.34514: 2015 Golden Geek Best Board Game App Nominee

190615.description:
User Summary

Build tracks, upgrade towns, improve your train, and sell goods in an attempt to be profitable.

190616.name: Röda Tråden
190616.description: Röda Tråden is a quizgame. The game comes with 80 cards with two subjects on each card. Every subject have 10 clues. One of the players reads a card and knows the answer, tells the other players the subject, and then, one by one, going thru the clues. The players can try to answer on high levels and get a higher score, or wait to answer and get lower score. Every player starts each subject with 10 points, and loses one for each new clue. The winner is the player with most points at the end of the game.

190617.name: Steel Battalion Controller
190617.description:
User Summary

A special, very large, and bulky controller was bundled with the Steel Battalion game. The controller has two control sticks and around 40 buttons. Only limited quantities were made available. These quickly sold out, making the game a collector's piece. It has since been re-released in limited quantities worldwide, with blue controller buttons distinguishing it from the first edition with green buttons.

190618.name: The Game With No Name
190618.description:
User summary:

The core rule book presents all system rules needed for play. The book is not organized particularly well, however, and there is little-to-no support for unexperienced players. The central mechanic involves a single D6 roll, attempting to "roll under" a target number which, typically, is a Skill rating. A roll of 1 is always success--and possibly good success, at that. A roll of 6 indicates "something really bad may have just occurred". Both 1 and 6 rolls require a second roll to "confirm", which occurs on a second roll of 1 or 6.

190619.name: Fab Freddie's Guns 'n Things
190619.description:
User summary:

This supplement is presented as a sales flyer, or "Winter Catalogue", of weaponry. The supplements notes that there is "free smuggling on all orders over 250k!"

190620.name: The New Quark Voice: Classifieds
190620.description:
User summary:

This supplement is presented as the classifieds section of a newspaper, pages B53-4. It includes various used conveyances and components, from sports cars to spaceship parts.

190621.name: 3GRP
190621.description:
User summary:

Character creation involves establishing a character concept, then generating Stats (Attributes) and Stat Specializations, then generating Skills and Skill Specializations. Characters also select Path Stats and Path Stat Specializations (roughly analogous to a loose class), and finally generate a background. All Stats may be generated using one of a variety of methods presented, from point allocation to randomization.

190622.name: Tales of Arcana Roleplaying Card Game
190622.description:
From the introduction:

Tales of Arcana provides a simple structure for a collaborative storytelling game. The Story Master (SM) leads the narrative while the players use cards representing their characters to affect the story. The text and images on the cards serve to guide storytelling. The players can’t reuse cards until they play most of their hands, so they have to be creative.

The ideal number of players is three, though the Story Master can decide to include more. Each game session takes 1 to 3 hours and requires at least 1 six-sided die (d6), which you can find in many board games...

Each player creates a character with a hand of six character cards. This represents the character’s narrative DNA. Cards can be drawn at random or drafted. A character hand must include 1 Race card, 1 Class card, 1 Trait card, 1 Armament card, and 2 Ability cards. You can use these cards to recreate classic RPG classes or beloved fictional characters. During play, you might pretend that you are that character, adopting mannerisms or accents, or you might simply describe his or her actions.

190623.name: The Caves of Valesh Kanos
190623.description:
From the introduction:

The Caves of Valesh Kanos is a one-shot story session designed to be played with the Tales of Arcana Roleplaying Card Game, though it could be adapted for play with other RPG systems. It is designed for one Story Master (SM) to narrate and three Players, with the overall session lasting 1.5–2.5 hours. Players will randomly generate their characters. Only the SM should view this Story Guide and should read through it before the session begins. Occasionally, [characters] will receive tips from two natives of Arcana: Manitous, the god of reality and Glytch, a fablead (story nymph). Glytch is very helpful, but it might be best to just ignore Manitous.

190624.name: Tales of Arcana Basic Card Set
190624.description:
User summary:

The Tales of Arcana Basic Card Set includes several pages of full-color, print-and-play cards for use with the game system. Most images are the faces of cards; only a single backing image is included.

The full deck includes 111 cards.

190625.name: Footy Feud!
190625.description:
Footy Feud! is an Australian football themed-card game.

Players are dealt numeric cards, and choose the highest value for scoring.
The objective is to have the highest score at the end of the game (played over 4 quarters).

4 cards in the deck allow stealing or score multiplication.

Do I need to know about Australian football to play the game?
No; Footy Feud! has tested very well with people of all ages who have no interest in Australian football.
If you are familiar with the Australian football scoring method it may make the game initially easier to grasp.

190626.name: Castle In The Darkness
190626.description:
One dark and gloomy night, the kingdom of Alexandria is attacked by an evil sorcerer and his army of darkness! Despite their best efforts to protect their king and their princess, the royal guard falls, one-by-one, to the forces of evil. One knight, unconscious but still alive, awakens on the throne room floor to find that the princess is nowhere to be seen! What's more, the entire city had been overrun by monsters! With sword in hand, he embarks on a death-defying mission to find his princess and to restore peace to the kingdom!

Castle In The Darkness is a fun and challenging shout out to the early days of video games! It's an action exploration platformer with some RPG elements, much like games from the Castlevania or Metroid series. It's super fast-paced, challenging, and full of so many secrets that hey all might never be found!

Source: The Game Website.

190627.name: Christmas Tale
190627.description:
From the publisher´s website:

In a small town far-far away, everyone is excited for Christmas. There are holiday lights in all the windows, the houses await the holiday all groomed up.
The kids are walking home from Christmas celebration. The way is long and slippery. And you have to stop so many times, to look at shop windows, talk, pick up lost hats, scarves… but maybe they have time to help the angel, too… no?

Players roll die and move forward. If they reach "Ice"-space the slip another space. "Deep snow" make You move slower. If more than one player is one and the same place they chatting and only 5 or 6 allows You to move again. And many other things.

Player who reaches home first is the winner.

190628.name: A Good Snowman Is Hard To Build
190628.description:
A puzzle game about being a monster and making snowmen.


Features


Help a strange creature to create snowmen in a barren world.
Solve mind-bending puzzles from Alan Hazelden, one of the twisted minds that designed Sokobond.
Drink in the charming graphical style from Benjamin Davis
Let the beautiful soundscapes from Ryan Roth wash over you.


Source: The Game Website.

190629.name: Maradj talpon!
190629.description:
It is the board game version of the popular tv show "Still Standing".
In this game every player can win! Answer correctly to the quiz, and you can keep your chance for the "money". Because if you are wrong other player wins.
All of the 10 characters will play until he/she "falls down".

190630.name: Life is Hard
190630.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




"Life is Hard" is a strategy/village management game. Your aim here is to control a tribe. Defend your village, harvest resources, expand your town, colonize the islands, upgrade your tools and weapons and contact with other civilizations. There is no specific aim in our game. You can do whatever you want. What would you choose – to help your neighbors to deal with the Vikings for iron ore or to rob them to get more? To pay the Normans tribute or to refuse, condemning your nation to war? To trade with the caravan or to loot it? Make your choice, but remember: every medal has its reverse...

Source: The Game Website.

190631.name: Lethal RPG: War
190631.description:
Journey on an epic quest with Lethal and his elite party of warriors through a huge fantasy land. Play as Lethal and his companions in exciting turn based battles against a variety of fantasy creatures.

Source: The Developer Website.

190632.name: Greyhound Racer
190632.description:
Welcome to the Sunset Isles, where greyhound racing is everyone’s favourite activity. Pick out a greyhound companion and train it to be the grand champion. Race, train and take care of your dog as you manage each week and plan out your winning strategy.

Source: The Developer Website.

190633.name: Draftica
190633.description:
In Draftica, each player is a Celtic chieftain assembling a tribe of 18 cards. Combinations of cards score points, and the player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

Players do this by collecting (or "drafting") both common cards in the colours red, green, blue and yellow, and rarer special cards that can provide a substantial reward for specialising in certain types of card.

Unlike some other drafting games, there is no lengthy playout phase to determine a winner - the game takes place entirely in the drafting phase itself, with many opportunities to outwit and outmanoeuvre your rivals. May the best drafter win!

190634.name: Rähinä Alias
190634.description: New version of Alias which challenges players to a rap battle! Two teams go against each other and try to beat each other with the power of words. Alongside with traditional Alias, Rähinä Alias also includes a Battle phase where players attempt to figure out rhymes from the given words.

190636.name: Orator
190636.description:
The object of Orator is to deliver the best orations on a variety of topics without making any blunders within a two minute time limit. Players attempt to avoid blunders commonly made in spoken English today, such as, 'umm', 'aah', 'err' etc.

Players may resort to bluffing to complete their talk however successful detection of bluffing and making of blunders incurs penalties. The player who is given the highest score by the other players (the audience) wins the round. The winner of Orator is the player with the best overall score for the game.

190637.name: Im flammenden Abgrund
190637.description:
User summary:

A Labyrinth Lord solo adventure.

190638.name: Sirasutopia
190638.description:
User summary:
シラストピア (Sirasutopia) is a competition to be the most charming girl in the class between two girls: Sirasu, an ordinary Primary School girl, and Pia, an avatar of Rabbit Tribe who is pretending to be a school girl. Players plan their days by choosing three out of five action cards.
