Each card has various effects, such as raising their statistics (intelligence or dressing), attracting a boy they like, and interfering opponent's actions.
After the third round, they gain victory points if they meet the conditions for a charming girl.

Publisher's summary:
平凡な小学生しらすちゃんと、ウサギ族の化身ぴあたんが
クラスのイケてる存在を目指すゲームです。
プレーヤーはしらすちゃんかぴあたんを演じ
5枚のアクションカードのうち3枚をセットし日々の予定を立てます。
すると、学力やオシャレ度が向上したり男の子の気を引いたり
相手の行動の邪魔もします。
それらを3ラウンド行い、最終的にイケてる存在の条件を達成し勝利点を得ます。

190639.description:
In Zany Penguins, you want to make sure that your tribe of penguins is the one that takes control of the Earth, so do what you can to take charge of regions such as the desert, jungle, and the North Pole.

In game terms, each region has a set of cards numbered 1-9. To set up, shuffle the deck, then deal each player a personal deck of 18 cards. Each player starts with two cards in hand.

On a turn, you draw two cards, pass one card each to your left- and right-hand neighbors, take the cards passed to you, then simultaneously play and reveal one card in front of you on the table. If you play a 1, on your next turn you play and reveal two cards instead of one; if you play a 2, it blows up all 6-9 cards played that same turn; and if you play a 3, on the subsequent turn everyone else plays before you do.

After eight turns, for each card color on the table in front of you in which you have the highest sum of all players, you score the sum of all cards of this color in your hand. For each color in which you don't have the highest sum, you score the single lowest card of this color in your hand. Players tally their scores, and whoever has the most points wins.
190639.name: Zany Penguins

190640.name: Kentucky Route Zero: Act II
190640.description:
Act II opens with a prelude in which Lula Chamberlain, an installation artist whose work is featured in the Kentucky Route Zero bonus content Limits & Demonstrations, receives a rejection notice from the Gaston Trust for Imagined Architecture. After reading this notice, Chamberlain sorts through a series of proposals for reclaiming spaces for purposes alternate to their current function, such as a proposal to reclaim a basketball court as a dog kennel.

Source: Wikipedia, "Kentucky Route Zero", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190641.name: Kentucky Route Zero: Act III

videogamehonor.32516: 2015 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Narrative of the Year Winner

190641.description:
The Act opens with Conway dreaming of a previous conversation he had with Lysette. The two recall a tragic event involving Charlie, Lysette's son, and Lysette informs Conway of a new delivery to be made, which will be the last delivery of Lysette's antique shop. Conway awakens from the Neurypnol TM-induced sleep at Doctor Truman's house to find his injured leg replaced with a strange skeletal limb giving off a yellow glow. After returning to the Museum of Dwellings to find it closed for the night, Conway, Shannon and Ezra resume their search for Lula Chamberlain in Conway's truck. The three are quickly stopped again, however, after the truck's engine breaks down. While Shannon calls for a tow truck, two musicians, Johnny and Junebug, pass the group on a motorcycle with a sidecar, and after some discussion decide to help the group get the truck moving again in exchange for following them to the Lower Depths bar to watch their performance. The group agrees, traveling to the Lower Depths and talking with Harry, the bartender, who gives directions back to Route Zero. After their performance, Johnny and Junebug decide to accompany Conway, Shannon and Ezra on their travels.

Source: Wikipedia, "Kentucky Route Zero", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190642.name: Just Four Kicks
190642.description:
From the publisher's website:
Have you ever found yourself...

Not knowing what you're doing at the gym
Being too drunk at a wedding
Farting in yoga class

Just Four Kicks is a hilarious party game where anything can happen through creativity, quick thinking, and general debauchery. Watch your friends try to act out “being too drunk at a wedding” or use someone else’s body to depict “farting in yoga class.” Bring it to your next game night and it'll be guaranteed to bring your friends together through countless laughs and just a touch of embarrassment.

from the back of the box:
Do you like fun? Do you enjoy laughing? Are you interested in having an all around good time? If you answered yes to any of these questions (hopefully all) grab a copy of Just Four Kicks and prepare to have the time of your life. Inside jokes included in the box.

Now I'm sure you're thinking, wow, this game sounds amazing, how is it played? Start by finding at least three friends (or strangers) and splitting into two equal teams. Just Four Kicks has four rounds of play that will get progressively more intense and hilarious, so choose your teammates wisely. Each player has 30 seconds to get their team to guess as many cards as possible by describing the topic, doing charades, or using someone else's body as a puppet. The team that guesses the most cards wins!

190643.name: BattleCry (2016)

videogamehonor.32540: 2014 PAX Curse Award Most Anticipated Game Next Year Winner

190643.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




The dawn of the 20th century – reimagined

Headed toward unthinkable catastrophe and worldwide armed conflict, the black powder treaty allowed the great empires to shape a different history.

The short-lived peace that followed gave birth to a golden age of industrial manufacturing and design. Fueled by technological advancements, the face of war was forever changed. All disagreements are now settled head-on by elite teams of chosen warriors from all over the world, with each member specializing in either high-tech ranged gadgetry or sophisticated melee weapons.

Source: The Game Website.

190644.name: Pit People

videogamehonor.32542: 2015 PAX Curse Award Most Unique Setting Winner

190644.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




Dogged at every step by a mysterious and power-hungry narrator, you'll need to rally your troops and steel your wits if you hope to survive a hostile world filled with sinister robots, deadly vampires and brutally adorable cupcake people!

Source: The Game Website.

190645.name: Eon Altar: Episode 1 – The Battle for Tarnum

videogamehonor.32544: 2015 PAX Curse Award Best Gameplay of the Year Winner

190645.description:
An ancient, malevolent force stirs within the depths of the Eon Altar, and it’s up to YOU to stop it! Eon Altar combines nail-biting action and turn-based tactical combat with an epic story of friendship, destiny and betrayal.

So far so good, right? But wait, there's more!

In Eon Altar, we’ve captured the experience of a role-playing tabletop game and blended it into a video game. How did we pull that off? Well, the magic is in your own pocket.

In Eon Altar, each player uses their smartphone as a private screen to see their motivations, thoughts and innermost secrets. Your mobile device also offers you lines of dialogues to read out loud—hopefully in your own eccentric performance you've developed for your character.

Your actions. Your game. Your way. You play your character the way you want it. Succeed together, or die alone.

Eon Altar is a groundbreaking local co-op RPG for 1-4 players.

FEATURES:

Each player controls the action on the monitor from their smartphone or tablet with context sensitive information. Not only do you control and upgrade your character using the controller App, you receive secret thoughts, quests and dialogue during the campaign mode.
Choose whether to share personal information with your friends, or use it against them as you make impactful choices and forge your own destiny.
Play one of five different characters, each with their own back story, decisions, quests and powers. Explore the dungeons below Tarnum in real time and fight in team-turn-based-tactical combat.
Take your turns in any order for maximum tactical ownage, or even simultaneously for super speedy fights. Upgrade and manage your character without interrupting other players.
NPCs are fully voice activated, but you voice your own character! Make decisions about how much you want to give away to the rest of your party, and how much you keep close to your chest.
Explore a deep, compelling and original sword-and-sorcery fantasy world in real time, and fight in team-turn-based tactical combat.
Defeat legendary enemies in exciting tactical turn-based combat in the Combat Arena as you are challenged by endless waves of enemies.




Source: The Game Website.

190646.name: Timespinner

videogamehonor.32548: 2015 PAX Prime Curse Award Best Soundtrack of the Year Winner

190646.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




Timespinner is a 2D Metroidvania Platformer about a young woman who travels through time to destroy the empire that killed her family.

Source: The Game Website.

190647.name: Through the Woods

videogamehonor.32550: 2015 PAX Curse Award Scariest Game of the Year Winner

190647.description:
A mother searches through a forest in Norway for her missing son. The story is heavily influenced by Norse mythology. Her son has been kidnapped by a mysterious being called Old Erik, who she wants to kill.

Source: Wikipedia, "Through the Woods", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190648.name: Close Counts
190648.description: Close Counts is the party game where the best guesstimate wins! How many Coco-Cola products are sold every day? What did the world's most expensive painting cost? How many DeLorean sports cars were manufactured? How many pennies would it take to circle the world? Don't know!?!? It doesn't matter!!! You don't need to know the answer, you just have to be closer than everyone else - now that's what counts! There are six categories of statistical fun: Time Traveller, Numbers and Nature, Dollars and Cents, Records and Feats, What Year Was That? and No Way! New 2015

190650.name: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt – Blood and Wine

videogamehonor.39253: 2016 Global Game Awards Best Expansion of the Year Winner

videogamecompilation.207782: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt – Complete Edition

190650.description:
User Summary

Blood and Wine adds a massive new land to explore and quests.

190651.name: Windward
190651.description:
Windward is an action-filled sandbox game that puts you in control of a ship sailing the high seas of a large procedurally-generated world.

Features:
- Large procedurally generated worlds for a unique experience every new campaign.
- Play with your friends via full cross-platform multiplayer! Bring your ship into your friends' worlds, or have them join yours.
- Play as much or as little as you like. The game saves your progress on the spot -- no need to save manually.
- Play it how you want: relax and immerse yourself doing trading and questing, or venture forth into pirate-infested lands for some high-adrenaline naval combat.
- Unlock new ships, find upgrades, recruit allies, fund new towns, build coastal defenses, even bribe pirates to join your cause!
- Extensive talent tree with role-specific specializations.
- Customize your ship to make it look how you want. Pink hull with black sails? Sure, why not!
- Procedural itemization system where higher difficulty automatically means better rewards.

Source: The Developer Website.

190653.name: Thrones
190653.description:
From the publisher:

Thrones is a two-player 9x9 board game where each players set their tiles and pieces secretly, screened from their opponent's view, until the screen is removed, the middle fifth row is set, and the battle's combat begins. The object of the game is kill their opponent's King; alternatively, a player may win by occupying his opponent's Fortress with his own King.

Each player controls 15 pieces at the beginning of the game:

2 Spearmen (infantry)
2 Rangers (infantry)
2 Crossbows (ranged)
1 Catapult (ranged)
1 Trebuchet (ranged)
2 Lancers (cavalry)
1 Warhorse (cavalry)
2 Elephants (cavalry)
1 King (infantry)
1 Dragon




In addition each player gets 36 tiles for building the playing Surface:

14 Plains
9 Forest
6 Water
6 Mountains
1 Fortress

190655.name: Fantastic Encounters
190655.description:
From the introduction:

A collection of twelve short encounters.

User summary:


The Rusting Pit (2nd-3rd level characters)
Deadfall (4-5th level characters)
To Fiddler's Green (3rd-4th level characters)
Idol of the Fire Drake (1st-2nd level characters)
Ferry Tale (5-6th level characters)
A Baker's Dozen (3rd-4th level characters)
The Chandler's Shop (5-6th level characters)
The Lonely Pier (2nd-4th level character)
The Curious Tome (1st-2nd level characters)
Adventurer's Best Friend (1st-2nd level characters)
A Broken Window (3rd-4th level characters)
The Compass Lies (2nd-3rd level characters)

190656.name: Dragon Dash
190656.description:
Cooperative tile laying game for children.

Build a path through the kingdom but watch out for those pesky dragons!

Includes game board, number and letter dice, 21 Path tiles, 16 Dragon tiles, and 3 Knights Gear tiles.

One at a time, face-down tiles are drawn from a stack. Path tiles may placed on the board as desired. Dragon tiles are placed according to the grid position dictated by two dice. Dragons much be avoided, but can be fought off with Knight's Gear once collected.

190657.name: Rise and Fall: Civilizations at War

videogamehonor.32691: 2007 British Academy Game Awards Best Strategy Game of the Year Winner

190657.description:
Rise and Fall is based in the first millennium BC, and features four playable civilizations: Persia, Greece, Egypt, and Rome. The game includes over eighty civilization-unique military units, as well as eight "hero" units—of which only one may be purchased during a game. In Rise and Fall, there are two campaigns: one follows the conquests of Alexander the Great; and the other, the fictional liberation of Egypt by Cleopatra.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rise and Fall: Civilizations at War", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190658.name: Coleco Telstar Arcade
190658.description:
Cartridge-based, triangular case includes light gun, steering wheel with gear shift, and paddles, one on each side.

Source: Wikipedia, "Telstar (game console)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190659.name: RCA Studio II
190659.description:
The graphics of Studio II games were black and white and resembled those of earlier Pong consoles and their clones. The Studio II also did not have joysticks or similar game controllers but instead used two ten button keypads that were built into the console itself. The console was capable of making simple beep sounds with slight variations in tone and length.

Source: Wikipedia, "RCA Studio II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190660.name: game.com
190660.description:
It featured many new ideas for handheld consoles and was aimed at an older target audience, having PDA-style features and functions such as a touchscreen and stylus. Unlike other handheld game consoles, the first Game.com console included two slots for game cartridges and could be connected to a 14.4 kbit/s modem. The second and last revision reverted to a single cartridge slot.

Source: Wikipedia, "Game.com", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190661.name: Action Max
190661.description:
The Action Max had a very limited release outside the US and only one PAL game is suspected to have been made. The Action Max system requires the player to also have a VCR, as the console does not have a way to play the requisite VHS tapes itself. Using light guns, players shoot at the screen. The gaming is strictly point-based and dependent on shot accuracy. Players can not truly lose or win a game. The system's post-launch appeal was limited by this and by the fact that the only real genre on the system are light gun games that play exactly the same way every time, leading to its quick market decline.

Source: Wikipedia, "Action Max", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190662.name: Halcyon
190662.description:
The system was planned to be released in January 1985 with initial retail price for the system was US$2,500. Fewer than a dozen units are known to exist and it's not generally believed that the system ever made it to retail. The design featured a laserdisc player and attached computer, each the size of an early-model VCR. Of the six games planned only two games were completed: Thayer's Quest and NFL Football LA Raiders vs SD Chargers. RDI Video Systems claimed that the system would be entirely voice-activated, and would have an artificial intelligence on par with HAL 9000 from 2001: A Space Odyssey.

Source: Wikipedia, "Halcyon (console)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190663.name: R-Zone
190663.description:
The R-Zone was a largely unsuccessful handheld console and would only be manufactured for a short period. Although the R-Zone was not designed to compete directly with any other handhelds, it marked Tiger Electronics' first multi-game entry into the portable electronic game market.

Source: Wikipedia, "R-Zone", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190664.name: Nuon
190664.description:
User Summary

NUON was a failed attempt by Toshiba, Motorola, Samsung, and Raite Optoelectronics to add gaming, internet, and enhanced navigation to certain DVD players. NUON technology was developed by VM Labs Inc. as an attempt to turn passive digital video into an interactive experience. A powerful 128-bit processor to embed in DVD players. The NUON had the power to decode audio and video while providing and enhanced UI and trick-play modes. More importantly, it provided a platform for 3D digital interactive content straight from a DVD player.

190665.name: Gakken TV Boy
190665.description:
User Summary

The Gakken TV Boy is a very rare game console that was only released in Japan. Small library of games. The exact number is unknown but it's believed to be six. The entire system was underpowered. The games were similar to early Atari games

190666.name: Yags: High Tech
190666.description:
From the introduction:

Yags High Tech covers the equipment available during the period from the early 20th century (Technology Level 6) through to the early 21st century (TL 8). Though it is barely more than 100 years, there is a huge change in the type of items available. However, they are all close enough to the present to be considered Modern, and for most people to have a vague understanding of what these periods in history were like.

190668.name: Habisfern: Rune Magic
190668.description:
From the introduction:

The Wizards of Habisfern are descendants of rune smiths and shamans from older times. Their magic is simple and straightforward, and for the most part it deals with the problems faced by everyone day to day. Not anyone can learn and use magic, and the path to its mastery can be difficult. Corruption and insanity are two prices which may need to be paid for careless use of these powers.

190669.description: No Quarter Presents: Forces of Distinction compiles all the “Forces of Distinction” articles from No Quarter magazine through issue #56 in one volume—over thirty theme forces with original fiction. No Quarter Presents: Forces of Distinction also includes two all-new theme forces unique to this product.
190669.name: No Quarter Presents Forces of Distinction

190670.name: Yags: SciFi Tech
190670.description:
From the introduction:

Everything here is suited to SciFi style campaigns, with faster than light travel, ridiculous energy production and weird new forms of matter. It may be suitable for campaigns built around Traveller, Babylon 5 or the Foundation series. It's aimed at the harder end of Hollywood SciFi, rather than the type of futures portrayed in modern SF books. If you want a harder, grittier future than Ultra Tech will be designed to cover this, following a branch of future technology where computational power is not restricted by storytelling requirements.

190671.name: Yags: Science Fiction Characters
190671.description:
From the introduction:

The standard character generation rules for Yags assume a modern setting, and though the mechanics are pretty similar in other settings, the skills and backgrounds available can be quite different in most science fiction settings.

Even so, what is presented here are generic rules for science fiction, which make a number of assumptions about how technology works, and what the course of history has been. They may apply to some specific settings better than others, and GMs are encourage to make changes to fit their own settings.

190672.name: 6X: The One Page Role Playing System

rpg.32710: 6X: The One Page Role Playing System

190672.description:
User summary:

Players create characters using narrative statements only. The play proceeds along narrative lines with very little mechanical play aspects. When "facing possibly failure" a strategy develops a few outcomes which then are selected by the roll of a dice. Play then continues, incorporating the outcome into the narrative.

190673.name: Age of Wonders
190673.description:
From the introduction:

It was a time of invention, innovation, and new discovery! And it was a world that was waiting for new heroes of science and industry. Explore the steampunk America of 1893 at the World's Columbian Exposition in Chicago. Build new contraptions or learn the secret art of alchemy and join the likes of Nikola Tesla, Mark Twain, and Buffalo Bill in the effort to awe and inspire the world with visions of an age where anything is possible and nothing is unachievable!

190674.name: Zombie d6-lite
190674.description:
User summary:

Characters have four Statistics (Attributes) that all start at "Average" and can then be increased to "Good" by lowering another to "Poor". Once adjusted, they are permanent. Action resolution uses a single D6 roll (possibly modified by an Attribute) compared against an Action Table. For combat, a hit location chart is used (zombies must be hit in the head to be killed).

190675.name: The Grocery Store
190675.description:
A universal scenario for a zombie apocalypse setting RPG

From the introduction:

This scenario is a rough outline of a few areas in a small portion of a city. The areas are described loosely with some detail but not fleshed out completely. Since the intent of this scenario is universal, statistics are purposely not provided.

190676.name: World of Yo-Ho
190676.description:
A board game where your smartphone is your vessel, dice, cards...everything. A video game that brings people together around a board.

Your phone is your ship! It knows where it is on the map*, it moves around the board it interacts with other phones! Outwit your fellow pirates. prepare your actions secretly by holding up your phone, then put it back on the map to share the results with your friends and/or foes! A turn-based game in a living, animated world full of events, twists and monsters that adapts as you play. Save your game and you and your friends can resume it whenever you want!

Source: The Game Website.

190677.name: Strange Space
190677.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

You manipulate objects in your environment and ride platforms while dodging asteroids.

190678.name: You & Me: a game of love and intimacy
190678.description:
A fun game for lovers promising exciting encounters and romantic inspirations. With 90 innovative ideas, sexy suggestions and adventurous activities, You & Me is a game where the taking part really is almost as good as winning!

Roll the dice to see who will enjoy the intimate attentions of their lover as they perform one of the many passionate pleasures prescribed by the cards.
The player performing the action is the one who receives the points.
The winner is the first player to reach 30 points.

190679.name: Było Sobie Życie: Łowcy Bakterii
190679.description: In this game based on the animated series players attempt to collect since, toxins, viruses, and bacteria matching the colors on their player board. During their turn a player spins a spinner and takes the corresponding color of standee.

190680.name: Wonky Pigeon
190680.description:
User Summary

In Wonky Pigeon you play a wonky pigeon that delights in dropping bird poo on unsuspecting passers by. Fly around in the little town, find good targets and hit them.

190681.name: Cluedo: Doctor Who – The Hunt for Gallifrey
190681.description:
The Doctor may have defeated Missy and stopped the Cyberman army released from the Nethersphere, but his old friend continues playing her twisted games, toying with the Doctor’s mind. In her final moments, she reveals that she knows a secret he cannot resist…the location of Gallifrey.

But the coordinates she gives him just lead to empty space and in Cluedo: The Hunt for Gallifrey, you play the part of the Doctor, visiting nine recent locations, with six inventions to meet six recent enemies and uncover the true coordinates of your lost home.

190682.description:
This extension was on the back of the catalogue of the Haba Family Games. (In .PDF Format)

General rules:

The 4 bonus tiles are placed separately in the middle of the table at the beginning of the game. The first player that fulfills one of the four requirements receives the corresponding bonus tile. If two or more players fulfill the same requirement in one round, the bonus tile is removed from the game.

1 “Fastest treasure collector” bonus tile
The first player to collect at least 1 gold nugget or 1 crystal in every adventure receives this bonus tile.
Value: 2 victory points.

2 “Best treasure collector” bonus tile
The first player to collect at least 4 gold nuggets or crystals in any one adventure receives this bonus tile.
Value: 3 victory points.

3 “Best route builder” bonus tile
The first player to use routes to connect all the adventurers with temples that match their color receives this bonus tile.
Value: 3 victory points.

4 “Fastest runner” bonus tile
The first player to move all their adventurers at least once receives this bonus tile.
Value: 2 victory points.
190682.name: Karuba extension: bonus tiles

190683.description:
This expansion was on the back of the catalogue of the Haba Family Games.

General rules:

The 4 tiles are set out face down and shuffled in a stack. If a player picks up an herb tile with the value of "2" they can immediately trade it for one of these bonus herb tiles. To do so, the player picks up the top tile from the stack of bonus herb tiles. The traded-in herb tile is removed from the game.

1. "Gold sword" bonus herb tile
2 dice (instead of just one) can be used for the gold sword. The tile is removed from the game after it has been used.

2. "Platinum sword" bonus herb tile
3 dice (instead of just one) can be used for the platinum sword. The tile is removed from the game after it has been used.

3. "Magic gold herbs" bonus herb tile
Combat strength is increased by 5 points when the magic gold herb tile is used. The tile is removed from the game after it has been used.

4. "Loyal wolf" bonus herb tile
Combat strength is increased by 2 points when the wolf tile is used. The wolf remains at the side of the player as a loyal companion and can be used in every battle.
190683.name: Adventure Land: Herbs

190684.name: Hänsel und Gretel
190684.description:
Simple roll and move game. The first player to reach space 60 on exact count wins the game. The red numbered spaces represent events from the fairy tale that hinder or benefit the players.

The game was most likely produced between 1918 and 1922, since it doesn't show the "ABC Verlag" imprint.

It was also part of at least one game compilation.

190685.name: We Detectives
190685.description:
Work together with your friends and family to put the crooks behind bars!

Play as detectives and walk around the city hunting for clues and completing tasks. The Chief Detective has given you a 24 h deadline to solve the crime, make sure you complete your investigation by then or the robbers go free! Teamwork will get you to the bottom of each case.

Unforeseen events may hinder your progress, though....

In this game you move around the board taking your tiles to the required locations to collect evidence. Each turn before you move you draw a WePhone tile, and these might help or hinder your progress (give you extra movement, shut various buildings, or return tiles you've already collected to collect again). You are cooperatively trying to collect all the 12 evidence tiles before the game ends (24 turns, represented by the WePhone deck).

190686.description:
Each Anno Domini game consists of 336 cards, with a description of a historical event on one side of the card and the year (and sometimes specific date) in which it happened on the other. Anno Domini: Reisen und Verkehr contains historical events related to voyages of famous people, transport, traffic motorization, etc. Like all Anno Domini sets, this game can be played as a standalone or mixed with some or even all editions.

In Anno Domini: Reisen und Verkehr, each player receives nine cards (or fewer, if you want the game to be shorter) and may look only at the descriptions. In turn, players place a card on the table, trying to place their card in chronological order to those already present. Instead of adding a card, a player may claim that the order in which the cards have been placed is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct years revealed.

If the order is correct, then the doubting player receives two cards and skips a turn. If the order is incorrect, then the previous player – who accepted the order as correct or made it incorrect through her own placement – receives three cards. The first player with no cards remaining in hand wins.
190686.name: Anno Domini: Reisen und Verkehr

190687.name: Rebellious Archetypes Volume VII
190687.description:
From publisher blurb:

Be a Rebel with a Cause!

Not every evil lurks in deep, dark dungeons far away from innocent townsfolk, waiting patiently for adventurers to kick down their doors and start fighting. Some monsters don't just prey on society from without, but have burrowed and wormed their way into the very heart of the civilized world, and twist and corrupt the very laws that are supposed to protect the innocent, using them to oppress and exploit them, instead. These evils are no less a threat than the ones that most adventurers face, but many PCs are ill-equipped to deal with them. This is a job for rebels.

This book presents five new rebellious archetypes for five different classes. Included are the feral rebel, a hunter archetype whose animal companion can change shape, and who specializes in infiltration and sabotage, the bloody sickle, a medium spirit devoted to revolution and casting down the aristocracy, the guerilla agent, a ranger archetype that specializes in hit-and-run tactics and develops a taste for fighting certain organizations, the partisan, a skald archetype that focuses in winning over the hearts and minds of the public, by any means necessary, and finally the divine liberator, a warpriest archetype devoted to freedom in all its forms, who tears down symbols of oppression, lights the way of freedom, and inspires her allies to great deeds.

Whether you're about to embark on a politically-themed campaign (such as the official Paizo adventure path focusing on revolution), or you just want a selection of exciting new abilities for passionate and freedom-loving PCs, this book has lots of tantalizing options to offer. Even GMs can get in on the fun, as several of the archetypes here are perfect for rebellious villains as well, and can make for exciting and memorable encounters.

190688.name: Needle of Patti
190688.description:
From publisher blurb:

While doing due diligence going over some dusty tomes you have discovered a scrap giving you a clue about some magical items in a strange obelisk somewhere in the vicinity. The adventure takes the PCs across the Torgoth’s Causeway into the frontier. A few coins to a local sage and you will have a better idea on where to go…or so it would seem.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Dual Campaign for a 2-4 low level adventurers and DM. Primarily designed for two players, the FD series has included the opportunity for NPC assistance or with just four players. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

190689.name: Feats of Prowess
190689.description:
From publisher blurb:

The More Feats! PDFs introduce a single page of themed feats for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Every PDF contains a full page of high-quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Feats of Prowess includes nine new feats for martial minded or survivalist characters: Bola Binder, Huntsman, Kick-and-Toss, Study Weakness, Savvy Opportunist, Sense Shapeshifter, Scouting Companion, Tough It Out and Trampdown.

190690.name: Feats of Familiarity
190690.description:
From publisher blurb:

The More Feats! PDFs introduce a single page of themed feats for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Every PDF contains a full page of high-quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Feats of Familiarity includes ten new feats for familiar bonded characters: Arcane Scales, Black Cat's Crossing, Moonshadow Familiar, Nevermore, Skillful Bond, Tenebrous Toad, Tricky Familiar, and Venomous Vex.

190691.name: Trials of the Magi

rpg.26453: Trials of the Magi Roleplaying Game

190691.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trials of the Magi is a tabletop role-playing game centered around the idea that arcane spell casters known as Magi exist within our world and have kept their existence hidden for thousands of years. Those with the potential to learn magic are scouted out and must prove themselves worthy by undergoing a specialized exam.

Inside each session of this narrative card game a group of Candidates attempt to overcome the surreal and magical challenges put before them by the Arcane Scout. Where each success bringing them one step closer to becoming fledgling Magi.

Who is this game for:

While any group of players can pick up and play the game, Trials of the Magi was developed as a tool to introduce new players to the hobby of role-playing games. This goal is achieved through the game’s quick to learn, tactile mechanics and the ease of roleplaying within the game's fiction.
In contrast with most role-playing games, the characters that the players control in Trials of the Magi are direct representations of themselves known as Personas. These imagined characters look, act and talk just as the player would, making it easy for some one new to the hobby to step into their first game.

How the game is played:

The Candidates construct their personas by choosing 3 cards from the four possible Tarot suits of Swords, Wands, Cups or Coins. Then by answering a suit specific question they determine the source of the cards power, and write it on the card. This written word shapes the narrative capabilities of each card, as it represents what form of magic the Persona has access to within the mental landscapes of the trials.
Each Tarot suit represents a type of playstyle, and by picking a combination of 3 cards, you tailor your gameplaying interactions effectively create your own custom “character class”.

This hand of cards comprises the entirety of each player’s Persona, and gameplay revolves around each player’s ability to effectively manage how their cards cycle between the three positions of, in their hand, on the table, or discarded. This is crucial because if all of the players are forced to discard all of their cards, they fail the trial.

190692.name: Afterpeak Atlas: Oceania
190692.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you looking for a relaxing trip to a tropical paradise? Looking forward to kicking back on a beautiful white sand beach with a cool beverage under a palm tree?

Well, too bad because you won't find that here!

Welcome to the Pacific Ocean, Afterpeak style. Pirates roam the seas and horrible creatures lurk in the ocean depths. Even the sight of land doesn’t promise safety, for you never know when you’ll stumble upon a stronghold of the Servants of Chaos, a pirate base, or an island inhabited by cannibals eager to invite you to dinner!

Afterpeak Atlas: Oceania presents several of the islands and nations on the Pacific Ocean in the year 2045. It also includes new Light and Dark Lore abilities, new magic items, and new monsters to add flavor to your campaign.

190693.name: Red Fall
190693.description:
A fully cooperative survival miniatures board game. Mission-based with a highly modular game board.

Every player takes the roll of a survivor to fight against bad hunters and mutants, causes through the outbreak 5 years ago.

Red Fall offers a great combat system where positioning is the key to survive. You have to find Items, weapons, crafting upgrades with components to manage your character. You can learn skills to improve your chances to survive.

Beside the combat system one of the great and innovative game features is the enemy AI. Every enemy acts by itself. They have movement paths and smart combat mechanics.

190694.name: Dead By Night
190694.description:
In the survival game turned on its undead head Dead By Night, you are part of the legions that now hunt and stalk the remnants of humanity that survive in this shattered and ruined city. Each day still weakens you, and some mortals even attempt to hunt you down as you race against rival beings who are seeking the power to rule the night itself.

Hand management and consistent player interaction make this a fun and casual, yet deceptively strategic risk vs reward-style game.

190696.name: BlastZone 2
190696.description:
User Summary

2D space shooter remake of the 1999 Blastzone1 freeware game from 1999. Includes multiple modes including local and network multiplayer.

190698.name: Scott in Space
190698.description:
User Summary

2D action platformer pitting Scott the guinea pig against the evil Rhino Empire which is attempting to wipe out all guinea pig life.

190699.name: Final Exam
190699.description:
Final Exam is a pure 2.5D sidescroller crammed with frenzied action that borrows themes from horror films and teen movies adding a heady dose of caustic humor.

A group of four buddies visit their old high school for what would have been the mother of all parties, and find themselves trapped in a small town that has been invaded by a pack of monstrous and particularly aggressive creatures.
No horror film cliché has been spared by the chainsaw of the developers, Mighty Rocket Studios, and you can expect a crazy mix of monsters, baseball bats, rocket launchers and references to video games and teen horror movies.

Source: The Game Website.

User Summary

Although the game at the moment says there is a single player mode, that is only if you play with someone else or a second controller. The real choice is local multiplayer (2) or network multiplayer (4).

boardgameimplementation.11168: Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game

225366.name: Team Yankee: Bannon’s Boys – American Spearhead Force

190700.description:
Team Yankee is a tabletop miniatures wargame that is set in a fictional World War III in 1985 based on the novel of the same name by Harold Coyle.

The game is a standard two player miniature wargame with each player taking command of a company or battalion level force consisting of hand painted miniatures. The game provides one 6 different missions for the purpose of pickup games. There are also several scenarios in the book that allow the players to recreate some of the battles from the Team Yankee novel.

The game has an accompanying line of 15mm scale miniatures to use but it can be played with models from any manufacture.

The Game releases with 4 army lists that players may choose from, A United States tank Company, A United states Mechanized Infantry company, A Soviet Tank Battalion, and a Soviet Mechanized Infantry Battalion.
190700.name: Team Yankee

190701.name: Alien d6-lite
190701.description:
User summary:

Alien d6-lite is a super light-weight role-playing game featuring an alien incursion on modern earth. The extent of the incursion (abduction or assault, etc.) depends on the game master's desires. Characters have four Statistics (Attributes), including Strength, Stamina, Smarts, and Speed. Statistics are ranked with narrative tags such as "Weak" or "Tough".

190702.name: Call of d6-lite
190702.description:
User summary:

Call of d6-lite is a super light-weight role-playing game featuring the Cthulhu mythos of H.P. Lovecraft. The game presents virtually no setting background directly, leaving the game master to incorporate whatever elements he or she would like from elsewhere. Characters have five Statistics (Attributes), including Strength, Stamina, Smarts, Speed, and Sanity. Statistics are ranked with narrative tags such as "Weak" or "Tough". Characters who suffer a sufficient loss of Sanity must be removed from play (e.g., they are considered insane).

190703.name: Chrome d6-lite
190703.description:
User summary:

Chrome d6-lite is a super light-weight role-playing game featuring a Cyberpunk theme. The setting is only lightly developed but the assumption is that cybernetic implants are exceedingly commonplace. Characters have five Statistics (Attributes), including Strength, Stamina, Smarts, Speed, and Humanity. Statistics are ranked with narrative tags such as "Weak" or "Fast". If the Humanity Statistic drop too low, the character is considered a full robot and must be removed from play.

190704.name: D&d6-lite
190704.description:
User summary:

D&d6-lite is a super light-weight role-playing game featuring a typical high-fantasy setting. Characters have eight Statistics (Attributes), including Strength, Stamina, Smarts, Speed, Sneak, Spirit, and Spells. Sneak encapsulates all standard Thief/Rogue abilities; Spirit encapsulates Cleric/Priest abilities, and Spells encapsulates Wizard abilities. No spells, etc., or even specific ability tags are provided.

190705.name: Dinosaur Wranglers d6-lite
190705.description:
User summary:

Dinosaur Wranglers d6-lite is a super light-weight role-playing game featuring a setting with an oddball fusion of the American west with dinosaurs. Characters, assumed to be cowboy-style dinosaur wrangers, have four Statistics (Attributes), including Ridin', Ropin', Riflin', and Reckonin'.

190706.name: Modern d6-lite
190706.description:
User summary:

Modern d6-lite is a super light-weight role-playing game featuring a traditional modern (or near future) setting. Characters have five Statistics (Attributes), including Strength, Stamina, Smarts, Speed, and Sneaky.

The system does not use hit points and has only three health levels--unharmed, damaged, and dead. Damaged is not cumulative and repeated damage merely persists the Damaged state. In combat, roughly 8% of all attacks prove fatal.

190707.name: Saturday Morning d6-lite
190707.description:
User summary:

Saturday Morning d6-lite is a super light-weight role-playing game where players run characters that are from (or like) the characters from Saturday morning cartoons. Characters have four Statistics (Attributes), including Joke, Gaff, Prank, and Prop.

If two cartoon characters attempt opposing actions and both succeed, then reference is made to an "Audience Response Table".

190708.name: Night in the Woods

videogamehonor.41629: 2017 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Honorable Mention

190708.description:
It is an exploration game focused primarily on story in which players control a cat named Mae, who recently dropped out of college and has returned to her hometown to find unexpected change.

Source: Wikipedia, "Night in the Woods", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190709.name: Spy d6-lite
190709.description:
User summary:

Spy d6-lite is a super light-weight role-playing game with a setting featuring spies and conspiracy. The game can be played in a "James Bond" style or in a more subtle conspiracy style. Characters have six Statistics (Attributes), including Strength, Stamina, Smarts, Speed, Suave, and Sneaky.

190710.name: Super d6-lite
190710.description:
User summary:

Spy d6-lite is a super light-weight role-playing game with a setting featuring superheroes. The game can be played at any power level, depending upon the game master's preference. Characters have four Statistics (Attributes), including Strength, Stamina, Smarts, and Speed. Characters also have three Traits which describe their super powers.

190711.name: Western d6-lite
190711.description:
User summary:

Spy d6-lite is a super light-weight role-playing game set in the American west during the frontier period. Characters have four Statistics (Attributes), including Strength, Stamina, Smarts, and Speed.

Note that combat is particularly lethal, with about 8% of all attempted attacks proving fatal to the player characters.

190712.name: Hodge
190712.description:
User summary:

Hodge is a generic, universal role-playing system that is published as a free, online wiki with over 80 individual HTML pages. Characters in Hodge have Statistics (Attributes), Skills, Utilities (somewhat like class powers), and Styles (methods of attack). Statistics are given numeric ratings by points distributed from a pool. Likewise, Skills are selected and given numeric ratings by points distributed from a second pool.

While the game uses all of the standard polyhedron dice, the D12 is primary.

190713.name: Pax Britannica
190713.description:
From the introduction:

[Different players] want dinosaurs, guns, swashbuckling, robots, and magic, and the Pax Britannica setting was a way to produce a world in which all of those things can coexist without being cheap or gimmicky. At one time all of the things in this game were thought to be factual, all that I did is assume that they are and extrapolate from there.

User summary:

The web site features a complete role-playing system and a well-developed and quirky setting that is internally consistent.

190714.name: Feats of Spellcasting II
190714.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Aren’t there enough feats already?

Certainly it’s possible to make an extremely effective spellcaster without adding any of the feats in this book. However, rather than attempt to create must-have feats that patch rules in the game, or open entirely new ways to fill crucial party roles, this book is designed to just add some fun options. These are feats that give a spellcaster an interesting or defining quirk. These feats allow characters to pluck out their own eyes for magic sight, have power over spells they create (and name after themselves), and invoke magic items with words of power that frighten their enemies. They are designed to make spellcasters (and the games they appear in) interesting, unexpected, and memorable.

190715.name: Focused Disciplines
190715.description:
Publishers Blurb:

Psions are the quintessential manifester - students of the mind who tap into the varied mysteries and powers it contains. Yet psions can come in many forms - from the teleporting nomad, to the shapeshifting egoist, to the mind-controlling telepath - no two psions are completely identical. Within these different areas of study, some psions focus even further into one aspect of psionics, taking what are sometimes known as focused disciplines.

Contained within the pages of Psionics Augmented: Focused Disciplines, you will find two dozen new advanced disciplines for the psion base class. Each of the six psionic disciplines - clairsentience, metacreativity, psychokinesis, psychometabolism, psychoportation, and telepathy - get new advanced disciplines that focus on an aspect of that discipline.

Psionics Augmented is a series of products aimed at expanding the options presented in Ultimate Psionics.

190716.name: Slum Quarter Alleys
190716.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Right up your alley!

The well-lit main streets of the city may be safe for all, but what lurks in the dark side streets and hidden cul-de-sacs? Whether adventurers are searching for the site of a secret meeting or chasing down a cunning thief, the Game Master shouldn't have to draw every trash heap or collapsed building. This Pathfinder Map Pack provides beautifully illustrated 5" × 8" map tiles that can be combined into a variety of dead ends and shadowed passages. Inside, you'll find 18 richly crafted map tiles, including:

Back Alley Butcher
Collapsed Wall
Dead End
Market Square
Safehouse
Slum Quarter Well

Game Masters shouldn't waste their time sketching maps every time characters duck down a side street. With Pathfinder Map Pack: Slum Quarter Alleys, you'll always have dangers ready when the adventurers explore the seedier side of a city!

190718.name: CZFT Basic Rules
190718.description:
User summary:

Characters in CZFT have four Attributes: Strength, Constitution, Dexterity, and Intelligence. These Attributes are randomly generated by 1D10+8 each for humans. High Attribute Scores (14 and above) yield action bonuses. Characters have Skill Points derived from Intelligence and distributed into available Skills.

Most non-combat game rolls involve rolling 2D10 and attempting to "roll under" the relevant attribute (modifiers may apply). Hit Points are derived from Constitution. Combat takes place in rounds; each opponent can take one action in each round. Actions happen in initiative order. Combat rolls are made with D100 against the relevant combat Skill. Called shots are allowed but yield a penalty.

190719.name: CZFT Weapons
190719.description:
User summary:

Various weapons for the game are presented in a series of files, usually detailing one or a few weapons. Specific files include:


British Sniper Rifles
Bows and Crossbows
High-Tech Energy Weapons
Modern Weapons
HK416
HK417
L1A1
Modern Battlefield Weapons
TAR21
Type 05 SMG

190720.name: CZFT Aliens
190720.description:
User summary:

This supplement adapts the CZFT rules to genres including aliens of various sorts. The genre is broad enough to implement numerous styles of alien-focused gaming. The setting is provided as five files, providing alternate rules and supplemental data.

190721.name: CZFT Apocalypse
190721.description:
User summary:

This supplement adapts the CZFT rules to apocalyptic and post-apocalyptic gaming. The assumption is the "end of the world" is caused by nuclear war that has left behind irradiated zones causing mutations in animals and humans. A variety of "high tech" equipment and weapons also are detailed. The setting is distributed as a set of twenty-two files.

190722.name: CZFT Blaster Wars
190722.description:
User summary:

This supplement adapts the CZFT rules to a space opera setting reminiscent of several major motion pictures. The thirteen files in the distribution include primarily equipment lists and prices as well as a new race (wookie) and rules for droids. Additional types of melee weapons also are detailed.

190723.name: CZFT Chav Apocalypse
190723.description:
User summary:

This supplement adapts the CZFT rules to a post-apocalyptic setting that is dominated by "Chavs", or sort of a suburban gangster (the term is British slang for anti-social youth subculture). An unusual amount of clothing and bling has survived the apocalypse. The setting is intended to be played as satire. The rules contain a fair amount of slang; they are distributed in three files.

190724.name: CZFT Fantasy
190724.description:
User summary:

This supplement adapts the CZFT rules to a traditional high fantasy genre. This is the most-developed setting available for the game and is distributed as a series of 43 MS Word files and one JPEG setting map. In addition to variant rules to support fantasy elements, a substantial number of specific locations are provided and a possible major campaign arc (guild wars) is developed.

190725.name: CZFT Halo
190725.description:
User summary:

This supplement adapts the CZFT rules to a setting found in a popular video game. The basic premise of CZFT (small unit combat) dovetails superbly with the setting. Most of the six distribution files deal with equipment, skills, and team construction that mimics the video game.

190726.name: CZFT Pulp Era
190726.description:
User summary:

This supplement adapts the CZFT rules to pulp era adventuring (e.g., 1920-30s). There is a heavy focus on the south pacific region and numerous seaplanes are detailed in unusual depth for the game system. The equipment lists are (partially) presented as a mock Sears and Roebuck catalog. The distribution includes fifty-one files--many of them are images of seaplanes and several are regional maps (of Earth).

190727.name: CZFT Special Forces
190727.description:
User summary:

This supplement adapts the CZFT rules for special forces action, which is a natural extension of the base system. The supplement, distributed as five files, assumes all characters are highly skilled and extensively trained operatives in a modern or near future setting. The distribution also includes two (brief) scenarios: Terrorist Takedown and Convoy Protection.

190728.name: CZFT Western
190728.description:
User summary:

This supplement adapts the CZFT rules to an American west setting during the frontier period. Characters are assumed to be gunslingers on either side of the law or drifter cowboys. The setting is not well-developed, consisting essentially of a character sheet and period-appropriate equipment. It is distributed as two files.

190729.name: CZFT WH40K
190729.description:
User summary:

This supplement, distributed as sixteen files, adapts many of the monsters, vehicles, weapons, equipment, and other features of the commercial Warhammer 40K game to the CZFT rules system. Games Workshop's Warhammer 40K products are not needed to utilize the supplement.

One of the weapons files is distributed as MS Excel spreadsheet; the remaining files are distributed as MS Word DOC files.

190730.name: CZFT WWII
190730.description:
User summary:

This supplement attempts to recreate the World War II era style of combat utilizing the CZFT system which is well adapted to several types of adventuring in a war setting. The supplement is distributed as nine files detailing the vehicles and weapons of the era. A minor overview of the conflict is provided, and a scenario is supplied--Nacht der Untoten--which pits the characters against Nazi-created monsters.

190731.name: CZFT Zombie
190731.description:
User summary:

This supplement adapts CZFT to a zombie holocaust setting. Skills, weapons, and equipment are provided that are, essentially, modern. While "traditional" zombies are detailed a variety of "mutant" styles of zombies (with lots of variant powers) also are included.

Notably lacking from the supplement is a discussion of zombie causing agents or transmission vectors.

190732.name: CZFT Sci Fi
190732.description:
User summary:

This supplement adapts CZFT to a science fiction setting. Most of the supplement focuses on shipwrecked settings where, presumably, characters are sent to clear wrecks or salvage derelicts. These wrecked spaceships are found, typically, in the asteroid belts of our solar system. The "high tech" equipment presented is assumed to be what is fairly realistically available in the near future, based on our current technology levels.

190733.name: Rip Van Winkle
190733.description: Typical spin and move game. The first player, who cross all the route, wins the game.

190734.description:
This cardgame plays a lot like "Werewolves of Miller's Hollow", but with a twist.

The settings is the wild west, in a town called Tombstone. Two outlaws and a wannabe outlaw are hidden amongst the cowboys, and each night they kill an innocent cowboy. Their goal is to bring down the number of cowboys untill they outnumber them. But each morning the cowboys gather and hang someone, hoping to eliminate the outlaws.

Each player is secretly assigned a role : you may be the sheriff, the barber, the doctor, the priest or the hero. You can hide this identity, but if you want to use your special ability (like healing a shot person if you are the doctor, of taking the confession of another player if you are the priest) then you need to reveal your card. Of course, this is a risk if the outlaws consider you dangerous.

Unlike the werewolves, the outlaws can have a special character too. The priest, or even the hero, can be an outlaw. This makes the paranoia even bigger: when the cowboys decide to hang a person, why does the judge decide to let him free? Why doesn't the doctor heal the priest after being shot? This make the game much more intriguing. No more "hey i'm a special character i'm innocent"...

Another difference is that you can play the game with lesser persons. There are rules to play the game with up to 25 players, but slightly different rules to make it playable with 13-24 players, 4-12 players, and even 2-3 players. In the case of 4-12 players each player has more than one character, which means you are not eliminated out of the game as soon as one character dies.
190734.name: De vogelvrijverklaarden van Tombstone

190735.name: Pirouette Cacahuète
190735.description:
A card game to exerce memory. Each player in turn plays a card and either says the specified word or acts according to the specified action. The game continues until someone makes a mistake and forget the words or actions on hidden cards. Whoever has the highest number of cards wins!

Un jeu de cartes pour faire travailler sa mémoire. Chacun à son tour pose une carte et dit le mot ou fait le geste indiqué. Le jeu continue jusqu’à ce que quelqu’un se trompe et oublie les mots ou les actions des cartes cachées. Celui qui a le plus grand nombre d’« avions à réaction » gagne la partie !

190736.name: Recto Verso
190736.description:
From the publisher (translated):
In this game, the two faces of the cards are useful and each has a different animal. To win, nothing more simple: Get a hand of cards of the same animal. But be careful because each card played imposes an action that could work against you!

From the publisher:
Dans ce jeu, les 2 faces des cartes sont utiles et chacune comporte un animal différent. Pour gagner, rien de plus simple : Obtenir dans sa main des cartes d'un même animal. Mais attention car chaque carte jouée impose une action qui pourrait se retourner contre vous !

190737.description:
Star Wars: Star Battle takes the player to the very heart of conflict between Empire and Rebellion. At every move you must make decisions that will determine the fate of the squads you command. Your pilots must face attacks from the enemy's TIE fighters Star Destroyers and and even Lord Vader's advanced TIE fighter. How many men will you risk on a particular course of action?

A game for 2-4 players where you take a role as a You are the Leader of the elite group of six rebellion squads attempting to be the first to reach the "Objective Line- destroy the Death Star". Your task is to get through 3 enemy lines while trying to limit your casualties. It's a "push your luck" game where you roll dice and play cards matching the roll, after which you can decide to try to advance further, or stop and carry out card actions. Pushing too far could incur heavy losses.
190737.name: Star Wars: Star Battle

190738.description:
77 TENZI games in 3 variations: Regular, pattern, and non-speed. Each of the 77 cards in the deck have its own pattern or rules you can use to modify your TENZI game. The pack also comes with 3 blank cards you can write your own rules on.

Adding this to your Tenzi dice is paramount in making the game fun for multiple rounds. Always yell "Tenzi" to signal that you've won. All the pattern cards use 9 dice to create the pattern but don't forget to roll a 6 on the final dice in order to win! The non-speed rounds change the game up greatly. You either take turns rolling the dice in rounds or all roll your dice together. If no one has won then continue on to the next round.
190738.name: 77 ways to play TENZI

190739.name: Dragon Dash
190739.description:
The Queen has called on her fearless knights to help unite the kingdom. In this cooperative game, players must build a safe path across the green fields of Dragonwood while dashing past diving dragons! Will you make it before you run out of resources? Or will the dragons be victorious.

Players take turns drawing tiles and placing paths to connect both sides of the board and randomly placing dragon tiles with the roll of the dice. Players must connect both sides of the board with one continuous path to win. If the dragons block the path so that it cannot connect, the game is lost. Along the way, players may collect knight's gear (shield, helmet and sword) which may be used to defeat dragons who may attempt to destroy their paths.

190740.description:
From the box:

Taking place against the backdrop of the brutal Sanctus Reach campaign, Stormclaw pits the Space Wolves of Krom Dragongaze against the Orks of the barbaric Warboss Grukk Face-rippa. Inside this box you will find a fantastic collection of Citadel miniatures representing the key warriors of this conflict. In addition, there is a narrative book and a compact version of the Warhammer 40,000 rules, allowing you to read about and reenact the pivotal battles.
190740.name: Warhammer 40,000: Sanctus Reach – Stormclaw

190741.name: Starfleet Legions
190741.description:
ENGLISH
Starfleet Legions is a card game for 1-4 players which takes us to a science fiction universe where humanity is threatened by the alien Insectoids: A highly hostile race intended to end our specie. You'll be in command of a infantry squad, traveling through the galaxy and eliminating the threat. Starfleet Legions is a competitive game. The squadron with the most Victory Points at the end of the game wins. You'll need get the most from your 4 soldiers, equip them with the best possible weapons and use cunning tactics.

During combats, each player will be drawing and allocating result cards for the members of their squads, trying to maximize casualties and considering their strengths and advantages. All the result decks have the same proportion of cards: critical success (1), success (2), partial success (3), partial failure (1), failure (2) and fumble (1). When a card is assigned to a soldier, it can no longer be changed during that round of combat. All results are evaluated at the end of the round depending on the skills and equipment of each soldier in the squad. Requiring enemies are eliminated before those who has survived attack the squad members.

ESPAÑOL:
Starfleet Legions (Las Legiones del Espacio), es un juego de cartas de 1 a 4 jugadores, que nos traslada a un universo de ciencia ficción en el que la Humanidad se encuentra amenazada por los Insectoides alienígenas: Una raza altamente hostil, que pretende acabar con nuestra especie. Estarás al mando de una Escuadra de infantería de Las Legiones del Espacio, encargada de viajar a lo largo de la galaxia, eliminando a la amenaza Insectoide allí donde se encuentre. Starfleet Legions es un juego competitivo, en el que la Escuadra con mayor cantidad de Puntos de Victoria resultará vencedora al final de la partida. Deberás sacar el máximo partido posible a tus cuatro Soldados, equiparlos con las mejores armas posibles y utilizar sus tácticas con astucia.

Durante los combates, cada jugador extrae y asigna cartas de resultado para los miembros de su escuadra, tratando de maximizar las bajas y teniendo en cuenta sus fortalezas y ventajas. Todos los mazos de resultados tienen la misma proporción: crítico (1), éxito (2), éxito parcial (3), fallo parcial (1), fallo (2) y pifia (1). Cuando se asigna una carta a un soldado, ya no se puede cambiar durante ese asalto de combate. Todos los resultados son evaluados al final de la ronda en función de las habilidades y equipo de cada soldado en la escuadra. Los enemigos que se requieran son eliminados antes de que, los que ha sobrevivido ataquen a los miembros de la escuadra.

190742.description:
Holiday Special 2015

In uncertain times mysterious objects appear in the void of the galaxy. Rumored to be sent through space/time rifts by the Elders, these caches contain wonders that help the civilizations through the dark. They can be used for great benefit by those who are able to share the contents.

Eclipse: Gift of the Elders is a print and play expansion. It adds Elder Gift Tiles which will come available in a randomly determined round during a special Gift Phase. Each Gift Tile has a unique effect like gaining resources, gaining ships, gaining VPs for certain features.
190742.name: Eclipse: Gift of the Elders

190743.description:
3 new skills to play with the path to Ta-Seti and a new black power tile originally distributed as promo items during Essen 2015.

Contains the follwing gaming material:

1 black power tile:

Piety: awards one additional permanent VP if you control at least 2 temples at the beginning of the night phase




3 new skills available on the path to Ta-Seti:

Immunity: ignore any damage outside of combat
Neith Shields: +1 protection during battle
Offering: after battle, gain 1 prayer point per opposing unit destroyed in this battle




Note: "Kemet: Ta-Seti" expansion is required in order to use these new power tile and skills.
190743.name: Kemet: Skills and Black Power Tile For Ta-Seti

190744.description:
3 new power tiles originally distributed as promo items during Essen 2015.

Contains the following gaming material:

1 blue power tile:
- Protective aura: ignore any damage outside of combat

1 red power tile:
- Night Expedition: one priest can move to the next location on the path to Ta-Seti during the night phase, without benefit from the bonuses between the locations nor taking any object or skills token on the location

1 white power tile:
- Reminiscence: At the end of battle, if the opponent has played at least one DI card, you may take one of them in your hand

Note: "Kemet: Ta-Seti" expansion is required in order to use these new power tiles
190744.name: Kemet: New Power Tiles

190747.name: The Twelve Days of Onyx Condition Cards
190747.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ho! Ho! Ho! We had so much fun creating the Overly Specific Condition Cards and a special [Condition Card for Halloween], we decided we wanted to try something new.

These Twelve Days of Onyx Condition Cards are holiday themed Conditions selected from contest entries submitted by members of our creative and awesome community. It was really, really difficult to choose our 12 favorites from so many awesome submissions, yet that was the task and here are the ones our Onyx Path team chose.

Part of the Chronicles of Darkness rules, Conditions add an additional layer of consequence and reward to certain actions in Chronicles of Darkness games. Various things within the course of a game can cause Conditions. These include exceptional successes, supernatural abilities, and really any situation where the Storyteller thinks they can be used to heighten the drama of a game.

190748.name: 2015 Onyx Path Halloween Card
190748.description:
User summary:

A Halloween released Condition card for Chronicles of Darkness games.

190749.name: Planet Crashers
190749.description:
From publisher blurb:

Planet Crashers is a pick up and play RPG system designed for one shot games. Players take the role of a cliche group of bounty hunters as they try to take down a galactic outlaw. The game strives for over the top action and outrageous dialogue as it pits players against the Game Master for galactic power.

Planet Crashers is a diceless system and instead utilizes a deck of standard playing cards and poker chips, in a las vegas style wager system. Drawing inspiration from such shows as Space Dandy and Gurren Lagann, Planet Crashers aims to be a comedic and exilerating adventure for all.

190750.name: Gremlin Grimoire
190750.description:
From publisher blurb:

This illustrated bestiary includes twenty nasty gremlins and gremlin-kin. Come be baffled by the Wishlings, dodge the Ukobach's flaming oil, tread through the Toadstoolkin's tainted gardens, and challenge the Nurahiyon for mastery of hearth and home: All of these, and more, are detailed within the pages of the Gremlin Grimoire.

Gremlins abound, causing mischief and havoc throughout civilization - the Akaname loiters in latrines, eating offal and cursing its poor victims to become Akaname themselves. Meanwhile, the Sky Rippers attack the airships and flying citadels that ply the skies. The Bes both protect and terrify the children under their guard, and the Nebutori stuff their unsuspecting victims full of delicious, fattening food until their victims are weak and glutted. Come see the weird, bizarre (and oft dangerous) world of the Gremlins in this, the third bestiary book from Menagerie Press.

190751.name: Creatures of Faerie
190751.description:
From publisher blurb:

This illustrated bestiary includes twenty-four creatures from the Realm of Faerie. Come challenge the Aos Si within their subterranean realm, avoid being skinned by the fearsome Blooddybone, hunt the wolf-like Cù-Sìth, engage in a battle of wits with the Far Darrig, survive the famishing Fear Gorta, or quaff the strongest of brews with the Wodewose. Meet these Fey beings and many others within the Creatures of Faerie.

190752.name: Vampires
190752.description:
From publisher blurb:

A vampire is a being from folklore who subsists by feeding on the life essence, typically blood, of living creatures. But what do they look like as a member of the undead, what was their life like, how do they feed?

All these aspects and more are covered in this volume of the CDG. The CDG (Creature Description Generator) range is designed with a fantasy setting in mind, but can easily be used for sci-fi or modern/horror settings.

Aspects covered by this Creature Description Generator:

Apparent previous life: What was the vampire in their previous life before they were turned into the undead?
Bane/Weakness: What causes the vampire harm or can weaken them so they can finally be killed? Not all vampires are repulsed by holy symbols.
Clothing: What is the state of their clothing? Is it in pristine condition? Related to their previous life?
Companions: Is the vampire on their own, or do they have followers and others looking after them?
Features: This aspect covers their eye colouration, skin and anything normally visible.
Feeding: How does the vampire feed once they have caught their prey? What do they feed on?
Home base: Where and what does the vampire call home?
Hunting: Before they feed a vampire need to catch its prey. *How does it do that? Where does it hunt? Does it only hunt at a certain time of the year?
Killing Blow: How do you kill off one of these beasts for good?
Main goal: What is the main goal of the vampire now that it is undead?
Movement: How does the vampire primarily move? Does it glide with an unearthly grace, or appear in the shadows?
Powers & Skills: What skills and powers has becoming the undead granted the vampire?
Prey: What does the vampire hunt and what do they refuse to hunt?
Turned: How long ago was the vampire turned into the undead? What was their sire like?
Quirks and Rare Features: What odd personality quirk or rare feature does the vampire possess?

190753.name: The Berserker (Class Archetype)
190753.description:
From publisher blurb:

Warriors whose focus on battle is legendary, letting nothing get get between them and their next kill, including even the most grievous of wounds. This issue of Player Paraphernalia offers the berserker archetype for both the barbarian and fighter core classes, including new feats that compliment the archetype in either form.

190754.name: Shockwave
190754.description:
From publisher blurb:

Can the city survive her attempts to save it?... Shockwave!

A Power Level 10 Rival, Shockwave is a powerhouse who often winds up causing as much collateral damage as the villains she's trying to stop! Shockwave is an iconic figure in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

Shockwave is a young would-be superhero whose powers make her a formiddable foe, indeed. She's brash and ready to smash, and all-too-willing to tear up the streets in order to hit the bad guys as hard as she can. A perfect Rival for heroes who try to minimize such damage, she can be a real pain to reign in, or an ally if they need a heavy hitter and are willing to pay the insurance bills. With a few tweaks, she might even make a beautiful disaster of a romantic interest for one of your heroes! Built under the same guidelines for a Power Level 10 Player Character, she can also be used as a handy "Guest Star" for a player visiting your game who doesn't have a character ready.

190755.name: Fahrt ins Muhltal
190755.description:
Orig. - "Fahrt ins Mühltal", eng. - "The trip to Muhltal (a municipality in the district of Darmstadt-Dieburg, in Hesse, Germany)".
The game consists of a board with holes in. Each hole scores a certain number of points. At the back of the board, a three-dimensional 'slides' is erected. Into the top of these slides, a player in his turn, drops a ball. The ball will bounce around the 3 separated slides and come out at the bottom and score points when it settles into one of the holes.

The points available range from 1 to 10.

The one who earns the most points, wins.

190756.name: Path Finder
190756.description:
Path Finder is an education game designed to help teach measuring and comparisons of length and area, along with logic and reasoning.

To play the game, players take turns rolling a die and placing a piece of the corresponding color (if able) in the carved wooden path.

In the Level 1 variant the goal is simply to fill up the path.
In the Level 2 variant, each player gets an equal number of pieces and tries to be the first to place them all.

rpg.24182: Mind's Eye Theatre: Vampire The Masquerade

190757.name: Pickering Lythe By Night
190757.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vampires in the Edwardian Era.

Noble families with ancient lineages rule this gilded age. The vampires seek shelter in powerful mortal houses to endure the tumult of world-shaking events. It is whispered that this little community in Yorkshire contains a secret that dates back to the Roman occupation of Great Britain and the terror that chased them from these shores.

This complete setting provides all the background, special rules, NPCs, and information you’ll need to stage stylishly decadent LARPs in the spirit of Downton Abbey, The Woman in Black, Gosford Park, and The Forsyte Saga.

Pickering Lythe is a complete scenario for Mind's Eye Theatre: Vampire The Masquerade.

It contains everything that you need to prepare, manage, and run a complete MET:VTM story set in the Edwardian era.

The plot and NPCs are presented in interlocking but discrete segments, allowing Storytellers to adapt them as needed to their own chronicles.
Contains information on how to create different types of plots for a variety of player tastes and interests.
Includes are many printable handouts, such as story seeds and character sheets.

190758.name: Psychomachia
190758.description:
Psychomachia is a strategic card game in which you collect and command the seven deadly sins and seven heavenly virtues.

Each turn, players throw tokens that determine the quantity of virtuous and sinful actions that they will be able to perform. With these actions, players can place cards on the table, move cards to heaven, earth and hell, and summon the powers of the virtues and sins on their table and in their hand.

The goal of Psychomachia is to be the first person to place all seven virtues in heaven or all seven sins in hell, using any permitted combination of the four types of cards found in the game: Sin\Virtue cards, Heavenly Virtue cards, Deadly Sin cards, and Fate wildcards. Along the way, you can use the special powers of the virtues and sins in your possession to complete your collection first, or prevent other players from completing theirs.

190759.name: Pixel Heroes: Byte & Magic
190759.description:
„Listen! The end is nigh!! Hear my words and prepare! An ancient cult has set foot in our lands! They call themselves -The Sons of Dawn- and pray to some dark elder god. They have started recruiting people for their cause all over the country. I fear that they want to try to awaken something which should be left sleeping. Something dangerous and sinister! Something that might destroy us all. Spend your last of days wisely...“

Enter the world of PIXEL HEROES and prepare yourself for a thrilling RPG/Roguelike experience like you have never seen before!

Explore a randomized world full of hilarious events, deadly dungeons and the weirdest NPCs you will ever meet in a game!

Choose three heroes for your party and take them on a journey that will be completely different each time you start a new game. Bath in a pool of procedurally generated loot and defeat the evil forces that threaten the township of Pixton!

Source: The Publisher Website.

190760.name: Quiplash
190760.description:
For 3-8 Players and an Audience of thousands! Your phones or tablets are your controllers! The gut-busting, say-anything, no-rules party game!

Source: The Publisher Website.

190761.name: History of Civilizations
190761.description:
History of Civilizations is a card-driven civilization game for 3 to 8 players that depict the rise and fall of empires from 4000BCE to 1900CE. Each player leads his empires to Glory through conquest, trade, science, religion, wealth, culture and many other means. The player with most Glory at the end of the game is the winner.

History of Civilizations differs from most other civilization board games as each player controls several civilizations at once. The game is divided into 5 Ages and takes place on a map spanning the entire world. Each round, players will take turns playing cards from their hand to build cities and wonders, move units, adopt religions, gain powerful leaders, trade with other empires, produce new units and many other things. Each card also depicts an empire that can be started if the game has reached a certain age and an event.
