190896.name: Rats - Time is running out!
190896.description:
User Summary

Get in - get out. All before time runs out.

Join Red Eyes the Rat as he attempts the heist of the century. Run through labyrinthine bank corridors, evade the cat guards, control time, and solve puzzles to access the vault. Then, once you steal the diamond escape before time is up.

190899.name: LogiGun
190899.description:
About the Game
LogiGun is a physics-based puzzle platformer. Take control of June as she climbs a tower filled with perplexing puzzles. Mix and match a variety of neat guns to solve your way through increasingly complex challenges. Also this other person keeps telling her to leave. I wonder what's up with that?


Forty mind-bending levels to traverse and solve!
Wield powerful devices that create platforms at will, push and pull objects and much more!
Fully dynamic physics makes boxes move just like in the movies!
Use bombs, lasers, fire and gravity in crazy and inventive ways!
100% Combat-Free!
Ponytail physics!
A story?
Music by Lavontae Lewis!


Source: The Game Website.

190906.name: Umbra
190906.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




An isometric open world action-RPG in a corrupted world falling apart. You are a former officer of army of the Human Republic, forced to flee the death penalty because of the magic powers you have unwillingly developed. Being tracked down by humans and hunted by the monsters of the Wild, you are recruited by a mysterious group of Templars. And thus an epic adventure begins in which you will wander the world to fight inhuman, mutated monsters and discover the terrible secret of the extinguishing mankind.

Source: The Game Website.

190907.name: EN5ider (Issue 43 - Oct 2015)
190907.description:
Dia de los Dinosaurios Muertos

A fantasy adventure for 4-5 PCs of 14th level.

190908.description:
In the mid-1920's, three investigators track the strange actions of a secret society plotting the return to Earth of a powerful ancient occult extra-terrestrial entity. Will you dare to delve into the depths of darkness and forgotten realms where depraved humans perpetuate unspeakable pagan rites and worship mighty malevolent supernatural beings?

190911.name: Shigarami
190911.description:
User summary:
シガラミ (Shigarami), meaning "bond" or "shackle" in Japanese, is a boardgame about the business world.

The players, as well-established businesspersons having strong connections with various industries, move between 5 areas, including the government office district, business district, and bay area, and invest in enterprises to gain "performance points".

The game's most distinctive feature is the system whereby "the players have various special abilities at the start of the game, but they must discard them in order to gain points."

Among the 10 types of special abilities available for the players, only 7 of them are used during the game. The game development is also influenced by the abilities applied in the game.

This game is recommended for relatively heavy-weight gamers.

Publisher's summary:
「シガラミ」は、ビジネスの世界をテーマにした本格ボードゲームです。
プレイヤーは、社会的に成功を修め各業界と太いパイプを持つビジネスマンとなり、官庁街・商業地区・湾岸地区など５つに分かれたエリアを行き来しながら、事業に投資して「業績ポイント」を稼ぎます。

最大の特徴は、『プレイヤーはゲーム開始時に様々な特殊能力を持っているが、得点を稼ぐためには、特殊能力を捨てなければならない』というシステムです。

プレイヤーが持つ特殊能力は、10種類用意されていますが、ゲーム中には７種類しか使いません。どの能力をゲームに採用するかで、ゲーム展開が変わってくるのも魅力の一つ。

本格的なボードゲーム好きな方にお勧めの一品です。

190912.name: War Journal II
190912.description:
From publisher blurb:

This manuscript includes information that may be critical to the success of the players in your war bound campaign. It’s pages hold information on the medic, a mundane healer who can patch up friendlies and keep them moving until more permanent doctoring can be had. Not only that but these medics can mitigate the effects of diseases, or even some curses and the lingering effects of death. Don’t think they just sit on the sideline however the medic is also a competent melee combatant ready to hang out on the front lines. But when it comes to the darker side of war, none push through more than the shadowknight, a dark avenger, the shadowy fist of an ideal. They are not fair, but of what use is fairness in war? Also included is the legend wielder and his legendary weapon. These are the weapons of which songs are sung, and entire battles shift when someone unsheathes an item of its magnitude. The brother of the vulture stands ready to sanctify the dead and to destroy any undead that may stand before him.

What good would a manuscript of war be without some strategic insights? Presenting a new feat type, strategy feats. A party tactician can extend a benefit to all allies near to him, and with each new strategy comes more vision into brilliant maneuvers which can be accomplished.

Included:

New classes and options to make the most out of any warring setting.
2 New Base Classes the Medic and the Shadowknight
2 Prestige Classes the Brother of the Vulture, and the Legend Wielder
New “Strategy Feats” and the Strategist Cavalier Archetype.

190913.name: Trivial Pursuit Family Edition Featuring the Magic of Disney
190913.description: Trivial Pursuit Featuring the Magic of Disney Family Edition Master Game from Parker Brothers and Horn Abbott. Game includes two sets of questions (one for kids and one for adults). This is a complete boxed set including the cards and a Disney themed board.

190915.description:
BetaBotz is a fun and competitive multiplayer board game where players bid on robots, upgrade their robot with components and execute powerful codes to accomplish tiered missions. Each mission provides the players a currency reward giving them more bidding power and bringing them closer to victory. Robots will need to work with and against one another to become the ultimate BetaBot worthy of entering Robotopia.

BetaBotz takes minimal time to learn but includes enough variation in content and strategy that no two games are the same. The simultaneous mission feature of BetaBotz allows all players to participate during missions. There is a high level of engagement and interaction between the players so that everyone can have a blast through the entirety of game play!

Players start BetaBotz with 40 bitz (currency) and use this starting pool to bid on a robot body with stats in four attributes (Agility, Firepower, Structure and Processor). Throughout the game players use their remaining bitz and any bit rewards received to bid against one another on components that increase their attributes or select single use "Code Cards" in an effort to complete missions. In addition to components increasing a robot's ability to complete missions, achieving a stat of 13 or more in an attribute activates a power associated with that attribute.

A complete game of BetaBotz is played over the course of ten missions. Mission cards of different tiers are selected based on the number of players. Missions require at least a specific value in one (or multiple) of the four attributes to complete. All players attempt to complete the current mission simultaneously and those that are successful receive a reward of bitz. Players are able to form teams to complete the current mission but they must split the mission rewards among the team. At the conclusion of the 10th mission the player with the highest individual attribute, the most gold components and code cards each receive an additional bitz reward. The player with the most bitz at the end of the game, including the bonus bitz, is the winner.
190915.name: BetaBotz

In the mid-1920's, three investigators track the strange actions of a secret society plotting the return to Earth of a powerful ancient occult extra-terrestrial entity. Will you dare to delve into the depths of darkness and forgotten realms where depraved humans perpetuate unspeakable pagan rites and worship mighty malevolent supernatural beings?

190924.name: Leaving Earth: Outer Planets
190924.description:
An expansion for Leaving Earth, adding the giant outer planets of the Solar System (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune).

New missions lead you to survey the outer planets and their moons. Depending what you find there, more missions may become available, leading to further journeys to the outer planets.

190925.name: Star Trek Road Trip
190925.description:
Roll and move game set in the Star Trek TOS milieu

From the rulebook:

Travel the game board of uncharted systems and planets to compete in Starfleet Academy's 'Enterprise Challenge." Carry out board actions, gain phaser tokens, and acquire access codes to enter deep space in order to collect federation tokens. Be the first cadet to complete your score card by returning all 4 unique federation tokens to your dormitory and win the prestigious 'Enterprise Challenge.'

190926.name: Sony Vertical PlayStation 4 Stand
190926.description:
User Summary

A stand with two knobs on the bottom that lock the console in place.

190927.name: Mech Tech Assault
190927.description:
User summary:

Mech Tech Assault is a light-weight, minimal roleplaying game that consists of little more than mech construction rules based on spending credits from a pool. Various weapons are assigned various dice types (D4, D6, D8, etc.). The rules do not provide any action resolution mechanic, however.

190928.name: Celestial Sword
190928.description:
User summary:

The rules implementation is exceptionally minimal and covers little beyond character creation. All characters are assumed to take a Class, which largely determines what type of powers their weapons will have. The game does not propose any mechanism for action resolution.

190929.name: The Rnodaj System
190929.description:
User summary:

The introduction states the game rules are derived from Dungeon Squad. Generally, the game is an ultra-minimal implementation of a standard race/class fantasy game. The game document offers a few "quests", or adventure hooks.

190930.name: Golden Eternity
190930.description:
User summary:

This supplement adds variant classes and new classes and spells to the base system.

190931.name: Celestial Sword Expansion Pack 1
190931.description:
From the introduction:

[This supplements] adds seven new classes and seven new abilities, as well as one more shop item weapon.

190932.name: Celestial Sword Expansion Pack Magicvolution
190932.description:
User summary:

This expansion adds new magic classes and abilities to the base system.

190933.name: It Came From the Ground
190933.description:
User summary:

This expansion adds several undead monsters to the base game

190934.name: The Red Gods of Babylon
190934.description:
From the introduction:

Most of the action in The Red Gods of Babylon takes place in and around the ancient civilizations of Egypt, Crete, Hatti, Canaan, Assyria, and India. Each civilization has a distinctive character, with its own unique religion, social structure and technological profile.

User summary:

The Red Gods of Babylon mates an atypical and well-developed setting with excellent mechanics. It has unusually high production values.

190935.name: Pirate Party Flyerbook
190935.description:
User summary:

This game product is freely accessible as HTML pages. It is a translation into English from the original German "flyerbuch". It includes pre-generated character cards and an introductory scenario, as well as the rules.

190936.name: Tiny d10: High Fantasy
190936.description:
From the introduction:

Classic fantasy abounds in this simple-to-learn, easy to play tabletop role-playing game. This manual will help you create a character, learn the rules, and in no time at all, play Tiny d10 [in a fantasy setting].

User summary:

The rules are presented in two pages; a third page presents a character record sheet.

190937.name: Tiny d10: Regras Básicas
190937.description:
User summary:

The Tiny d10 rules, with fantasy setting, presented in portuguese-language translation. Includes basic core rules with fantasy classes and abilities, including brief spell list.

190938.name: Tiny d10: Blood and Salt
190938.description:
From the introduction:

In this adventure, characters find themselves waylaid by a fierce storm in the sleepy seaside Whitefange Township. After only a night, unexplained events begin to take place. Children go missing, and townspeople whisper of strange shadows seen by the murky seashore. It is up to the characters to reveal the nature of the disappearances, and the mysterious shadows, and banish them from the once idyllic seaside township.

190939.name: Soul Eater Character Sheet
190939.description:
User summary:

The character sheet for Soul Eater is presented as a two-page PDF file that is ready for print-and-play. The sheet has color elements but primarily is black and white.

190940.name: Star Clones
190940.description:
Catalog Description

"The Star Clones disk includes four games. In the first game, Clone Trooper Onslaught, you man a laser cannon at a perimeter outpost that clones are trying to overrun. In Attack of the Metal Monsters, you must swoop down with your fighter and fire into the vulnerable viewport of the moving monster. In Desert Scout Daredevil, you must ride your land speeder across the ditches containing clones bent on destroying you. In Assault on Star Clone City, you must navigate through a swarm of asteroids and star clone fighters to attack the enemy city. Three skill levels. 1 to 4 players. CS-4527 $29.95"

190941.name: Soul Eater: Weapons Reloaded
190941.description:
From the introduction:

Weapons are people with the ability to become, well, weapons. This ability was originally created in an experiment conducted by the scientist Eibon and the witch Arachne to imitate the ability possessed by Excalibur.

User summary:

The supplement contains rules that supersede portions of the Version 1.1 core rules.

190942.name: Soul Eater: Natures
190942.description:
From the introduction:

[This document] includes:


New natures
Variant rules for choosing natures
Edge modifiers for natures
Traits for natures
Descriptions of all of them
How to award experience for roleplaying natures
An updated chart of values to achieve Soul Resonance

190943.name: Soul Eater Core (Version 1.0)
190943.description:
From the introduction:

Combine the fabulous elements of [the Anime] Soul Eater with the imagination-powered engine of a roleplaying game, and the anime world draws closer. Everything you need is in this document, except the dice

190944.name: Soul Eater Core (Version 1.1)
190944.description:
User summary:

This revision to the rules primarily adds additional information and options, as well as fixing various minor issues. The dice rules are clarified. Benefits and bonus pools are added. A few dozen Traits are added.

190945.name: The Brotherhood Source Book
190945.description:
From the introduction:

The Light emerged when the Darkness began its encroachment. Earth was the past, mankind’s birth-world, abandoned centuries before. Humans had spread across the inner worlds of the solar system and beyond, and humanity had experienced an unprecedented golden age of expansion and prosperity. However, with triumph comes hubris, and with hubris came the fall. All that mankind had built was on the verge of collapse, and decades of decay and war had undone centuries of progress.

190946.name: Capitol Source Book
190946.description:
From the introduction:

There are those who believe freedom is an inherent right of all people, no matter their race, creed, or corporation. This is an unwavering truth. So why do people of other corporations allow themselves to be draped in social and economic chains? Because they have proven unwilling to fight for their rights. They have let themselves become weak and accepted the rule of bullies and thieves. Not Capitol, though. Capitol is embodied by the eternal war for freedom, which began when the Pioneers first loosed their rockets and soared up from the dying earth. Capitol recognizes that any doubt or hesitation will result in nothing less than domination – if not annihilation.

190947.name: Imperial Source Book
190947.description:
From the introduction:

Imperial is unique amongst the corporations as it is not a single monolithic entity, but rather a conglomeration of clans, each equivalent to a freelance corporation. The clans come together to create what is arguably the strongest, and certainly the most diverse, corporation. Each clan has a unique history, skills, ideals, and desires, and they bring these to Parliament and the Imperial corporation as a whole.

190948.name: Mishima Source Book
190948.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Mishima Guidebook. If you’re a long-time devotee of Mutant Chronicles, you’ll find all the iconic Mishima stuff that you know and love, plus lots of new and expanded material. If this is your first time visiting the Mutant Chronicles worlds, then hopefully all of this will be new and exciting. There’s all kinds of stuff in here: underground cities, mystic ninjas, giant robots, samurai with assault rifles... you’ll love it.

190949.name: Animals off the Hook
190949.description:
These adorable animals will steal your heart in this crazy card drafting and dice stealing game. You will have to think on your feet to make the most of the animal cards you are given.

Overview
Each player chooses an animal to play. The cards are dealt and dice are rolled. Then players draft cards each turn and place their dice to try to get the highest score. Each card has two possible effects depending on which player drafts the card. To win the game, players will have to choose the best combos of dice and cards. After 5 rounds the hand is done and players add up their scores. See the tutorial link for more information.

190950.name: Inverted Dice
190950.description:
Inverted Dice is a challenging tactic dice game for smart adults and curious children. The game introduces a new way to look at dice rolls – a way to regard five normal six-sided dice as one big twenty-sided die (with some odd probability properties). Normally, you would throw some dice and calculate the sum of the numbers being shown. In this game, you calculate the sum of the numbers NOT being shown. Such a roll is called an inverted dice roll and is made with standard six-sided dice. You need five dice to play.
The structure of the game is a bit like the one in Yahtzee, with a similar score chart and three rolls (or fewer) per turn.
There are twenty rounds in the game. In each round, players take turns rolling five dice (inverted), trying to reach one of the numbers from 1 to 20 (it has to be a number that the player has not previously achieved or zeroed out).
After each inverted dice roll, the player chooses which dice to keep, and which to reroll. A player may reroll some or all of the dice up to two times on a turn, making a maximum of three rolls each turn.
If a player achieves an available result, it is registered in the score chart.
If the player fails (after three rolls), a number must be recorded as zero points.
Every player must put either a score or a zero into a score box each turn.
The game ends when all score boxes are used. The player with the highest total score wins the game.

Players can receive maximum three bonuses by achieving all scores in one or more bonus sections.

190952.name: Assault on Blacktooth Ridge (5E)
190952.description:
From publisher blurb:

Complete with customized anchored hyperlinks! Click on the map for locations in the Rising Knight!

The Blacktooth Ridge, far to the north and east of the more civilized lands, is fabled for its string of long abandoned fortresses, treasure houses, temples and underground mansions. This alone is an invitation for many an adventurer seeking fame and fortune. But it is an altogether dangerous place, tainted with the evil of the Horned One and those who still worship him in hidden caves and darkened temples.

Now, raids and plundering confound the settlements near the Blacktooth Ridge. The armies of King and Lord are warring in the west and few are left to protect this region. Rumors of Rottenkip the Goblin King and his fearless warriors taking up residence in the Blacktooth Ridge are circulating. Ogres and Trolls are raiding villages and looting caravans. Few are coming to the aid of those beset by these depredations and the evil denizens of the Blacktooth Ridge continue to spill out of the Blacktooth Ridge.

The call has gone out, the mustering of militias is at hand and the Blacktooth Ridge beckons to any and all willing to come to their aid and discover what is calling forth these foul creatures.

From the makers of the Castles &: Crusades role playing game comes the first adventure for would be heroes to test their mettle in the heat of combat.

The Adventure begins anew: Now.

190953.name: Rippers Resurrected: Deluxe Character and Campaign Journal
190953.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF file contains eight pages of form-fillable pages, including a customizable journal cover, character sheet, lodge record, expedition record, map paper, Rippertech discovered, and trackers for friends, allies, and nemeses.

190954.name: HC SVNT DRACONES Core: Extended
190954.description:
From publisher blurb:

HC SVNT DRACONES: Core Extended brings your HSD game up to the next level. Contained within this book are over two dozen new playable character options, new surgeries, new focus abilities and implants, additional playable races beyond Vectors, and lore detail to help players and Guides alike get a better grip on their world. All these features can slot into existing HSD games to provide greater depth and variety to your gameplay.

Core:Extended is an expansion to the HC SVNT DRACONES role playing game, and as such you will require the core rulebook to play. Rules included in C:E can be applied to existing campaigns immediately with no need to make new characters (though with all the new options, you may want to just to be someone new!) C:E also includes the C:E combat addendum, which changes the way combat works in HSD. That particular document is FREE, you don't need to buy this book to get it. It is now included in the HSD core rulebook .pdf and can be downloaded separately from the hsdroleplayinggame website for immediate inclusion in your games.

190955.name: Echoes
190955.description:
From publisher blurb:

A pair of deaths at an isolated facility in Mars' polar region has prompted an investigation into the safety and security of its inhabitants. Accidents happen, but MarsCo wants to be sure an accident was all this was. Your party is tasked with the difficult job of examining evidence, searching the facility, piecing together stories, and figuring out if the reports being sent back to MarsCo are the truth, or simply a cover for something significantly more sinister. If the latter is true, they can transform the operation into a criminal investigation. Of course, that would put in the same building with a potential murderer. Tread carefully.

Echoes is a MarsCo contract for parties of any size, centered around themes of investigation, intrigue and horror. It is recommend for players who are familiar with the HSD universe.

This contract runs best if the Guide has read it, but the players have not! For player convienience, printing has been enabled on this title. However, the images in this .pdf have not been optimized for print, and will be a little fuzzy on paper. For sharp, crisp images and vibrant color on a printed page, purchase the print version.

190956.name: Spices and Flesh (5E)
190956.description:
From publisher blurb:

A seafaring 5th Edition adventure for 4th level characters in search of plunder and fame!

While sails on the horizon can be reason to fear in pirate-infested waters, sometimes they bring good cheer and companionship on the lonely journeys across the endless blue. A chance encounter with Captain Craw and the good ship Tamarind seems like the latter, a friendly crew of spice traders offering warm hospitality. Yet all is not as it seems, as the Tamarind trades in a far different and more terrible cargo on a dangerous course into the hands of the legendary Shayonna the Gaunt and her desolate reef! Can your heroes uncover the Tamarind's deadly secret before they become the latest prizes sent to the clutches of the sea witch?

Islands of Plunder: Spices and Flesh is a 22-page 5th Edition adventure for 4th-level PCs full of mystery and peril upon the high seas and below the waves, incorporating investigation and negotiation alongside deadly danger on board ship and among the deadly reefs below. It includes two sets of maps, one for the GM and an unkeyed set for players.

190957.name: Beneath the Festered Sun (Pathfinder)
190957.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ancient evils awaken in this 3rd-level Pathfinder adventure!

When a heretical priestess met execution at the hands of conspirators, her immortal consort vowed to carry out her dying curse. Now, after centuries of plotting and waiting, the sky and stars have aligned perfectly to finally unleash her long-simmering revenge. Amidst the excitement over this celestial conjunction, a lone voice proclaiming the coming danger is mysteriously silenced and the wrath of the burning sun smites the population with a scorching curse. The authorities are overwhelmed, but can your heroes forestall this agonizing vengeance set in motion ages ago? To save the soul of a city, they must confront its past and its present to save its future, destroying the accursed avatars of a long-dead enemy—all before the twilight of the Festered Sun.

Beneath the Festered Sun is a 3rd-level adventure for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game that can be played on its own or as a complement to the first volume (#79) of the Egyptian Adventure Path from Paizo, Inc. It features a blend of dungeons to explore, mysteries to unravel, and interludes of intrigue and battle alike in and around the necropolis of Owot-ti, with opportunities for characters of every kind to shine. The Legendary Games tradition is to combine rich story and background, innovative layout, beautiful aesthetics, and excellence in design that is second to none. Grab this 42-page adventure today and Make Your Game Legendary!

190958.name: Echoes of Innsmouth
190958.description:
"Publisher Prefatory"

In “The Shadow Over Innsmouth”, Lovecraft fleshed out the town of Innsmouth and its dark past. This story is well known amongst lovers of dark horror, fantasists, and roleplayers with a predilection towards games such as tremulus (and others in this vein). Predictability can remove the requisite tension for horror to thrive, so liberties have been taken with the source material to restore some of the frisson familiarity otherwise takes away. Hence, the title of this work, Echoes of Innsmouth. Echoes begin from a source: a voice, a call, a cry, a scream, and are changed, mutated, and altered by distance, clarity, and the like. Liken this to jazz, where each incursion into Innsmouth is somehow familiar, yet different enough to intrigue even the most jaded Lovecraftian aficionado.

190959.name: Night Shift (2015)
190959.description:
User Summary

The Sun has disappeared and only you can bring it back by driving around solving puzzles.

190960.name: Cor: Il Paradiso Perduto
190960.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vacanze su Cor!
Trascorri giorni da sogno su uno dei pianeti più amabili e selvaggi della Galassia: le sue spiagge dorate ti incanteranno, le sue giungle ti regaleranno emozioni e avventure, i suoi alberghi ti offriranno ogni lusso e confort tu possa immaginare!

Questo recitavano gli annunci sugli schermi giganti di tutto il Braccio del Sagittario. Trent’anni fa.
Oggi Cor è il paradiso delle vacanze dell’Orda, un incubo a occhi aperti dove gli ultimi villaggi turistici sono occupati dalle forze di difesa galattiche, impegnate a sterminare i branchi senza fine di mostri che vi proliferano.
O, perlomeno, a evitare di farsi sterminare...
Imbraccia il fucile d’assalto, chiudi bene il portello dell’esoscheletro e preparati a essere sganciato in prima linea, pivello.
Benvenuto su Cor!


Translation courtesy of Google:

Holiday Cor!
Spend dreamy days on one of the planets most amiable and wild in the Galaxy: its golden beaches will enchant, its jungles will offer you excitement and adventure, its hotels will offer every luxury and comfort you imaginable!

This recited ads on giant screens around the Sagittarius Arm. Thirty years ago.
Today, Cor is the holiday paradise in the Horde, a waking nightmare where the last resorts are occupied by the forces of galactic defense, committed to exterminate the endless herds of monsters that thrive there.
Or, at least , to avoid being exterminated ...
Take up the assault rifle, close the door of the exoskeleton and well prepared to be released at the forefront, greenhorn.
Welcome Cor!

190962.name: Udaeus
190962.description:
From publisher blurb:

The mighty udaeoi of Cythea consider themselves the first-men, created by the god Saint Thero from the teeth of the fearsome World Dragon, and then given the divine decree to rule the world. They are the perfect warriors, they are the udaeus.

Contained Herein:

A detailed history of the udaeus on Celmae and their creation by Saint Thero.
The Udaeus player race with favored class options.
Feats, a Fighting Style, and Spells to complement Udaeus characters.
The Udaeus Paragon Racial Class-a complete 1-20 class for players who wish to fully explore the possibilities of this Mythic race!

190963.name: Tacoma
190963.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

Tacoma is set in the Lunar Transfer Station Tacoma 200,000 miles from Earth.

190964.name: Way to the Woods
190964.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

A story about two deer in a strange place.

190965.name: Glitchspace
190965.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Set inside a Mondrian-Inspired cyberspace world, you use a visual programming interface called Null, in order to progress. Stretch, scale, rotate, manipulate and create, discover and learn from a world of reprogrammable geometry and unlock the secrets that it has to offer.

Source: The Game Website.

190966.name: We Happy Few

videogamehonor.36774: 2016 Game Critics Best Independent Game of the Year Nominee

190966.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




The game is set in a dystopian alternate 1960s England, where the face-painted inhabitants of the fictional town of Wellington Wells are kept under control with a drug called Joy. The player takes the role of a "Downer," a person who refrains from taking Joy. The Downers comprise an underground resistance movement that is trying to escape from Wellington Wells. However, the town's citizens do not take kindly to Downers, so players have to act like they are high on Joy in order to blend in. They must scavenge for food and supplies as they try to survive in this procedurally generated world.

Source: Wikipedia, "We Happy Few (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

190967.name: Retaliation
190967.description:
User Summary

Can you find the answers lost deep within your memory.

190969.name: Evangelists Of Mars
190969.description:
From publisher blurb:

Evangelists Of Mars adds a new team of antagonists to the Kalos Universe: The Glorious Thrice-Valiant Evangelists Of The Martian Retribution! Also included is a popular Kalos Universe character who can serve as an ally, antagonist, or a romantic interest in your Bulletproof Blues game: Avalon.

190970.name: Hexlinx
190970.description:
From the publisher:

Hexlinx is an intriguing game of geometric strategy in which players start each turn with 6 tiles, then score points by trading, switching, and connecting them to build a honeycomb grid of interlocked rings. Each ring must include 6 different color tiles. When all the tiles have been drawn and no player can form any more rings, the game is over. Highest score wins.
Uniquely simple yet challenging, this exciting game of logic requires strategic planning (and a little luck) to win. For a variety of gameplay, some optional Rules can be used -- and because there are 2 methods of scoring points (standard and advanced), Hexlinx is FUN for children and adults of all skill levels !

190971.name: World of Metal Gear Solid
190971.description:
User summary:

Metal Gear Solid is a series of video games developed and published by Konami from 1987 (Version 1) through 2015 (Version 5). This product adapts the video game setting and tone to a tabletop role-playing game. The adaptation focuses primarily on the main line of five titles.

The mechanical game aspects are very light-weight. Characters have Attributes (Strength, Dexterity, Vitality, Charisma, Intelligence, and Perception) and Skills. Generally, Attribute and Skill modifiers are cumulative. The game includes a character sheet that lists Skills and Techniques (used in combat).

190972.name: Mod Basic Manual
190972.description:
The nuts-and-bolts make-anything RPG

User summary:

Mod offers unusual flexibility in a role-playing game, with most character rules open to interpretation by the players. Character creation does use concept, personal code (behavioral code), priorities, traits, stats (Attributes), and so forth. However, these are all intended to assist during character creation, not to limit what can be created.

190973.name: Zombie-World

rpgpodcastepisode.184437: Episode 60 - Origins 2016, Zombie World, Time Cellist

190973.description:
From the introduction:

Zombie-World is a hack of Apocalypse World which was created by D. Vincent Baker. It also borrows from Dungeon-World, another hack written by Sage LaTorra and Adam Koebel.

In Zombie-World, players assume the role of Survivors who find themselves caught in the middle of an undead outbreak. How and why everything went to hell isn't important. Once the dead start walking, all that matters is arming yourself, finding a safe place to hunker down, and having enough supplies on hand to make it through this thing.

190974.name: Free-Form Players Handbook
190974.description:
User summary:

The Players Handbook presents the full rules of the game, but it is not organized for inexperienced players. Combat in the system is fairly complex with numerous options and special situations. A spell system is provided. Character equipment must be placed in "slots". Characters have Rank (essentially Levels) in their Class, as well as Race and Attributes. The equipment lists provide everything from hand-to-hand weapons to high-tech weapons and armors.

190975.name: Awesome VHS Adventures
190975.description:
User summary:

Awesome VHS Adventures is a rules-light table-top role-playing game that is used to recreate campy action movies. Characters in the game have only three Traits: a name, a Campiness rating, and a Trademark. Campiness determines how many dice are in the character's pool. The Trademark gives bonuses in special situations.

190976.name: Ops and Tactics: Core Rulebook (5th Edition)
190976.description:
Fifth Edition, Version 1.04

Publisher blurb:

Designed for everything police investigation to para-military violence, Ops and Tactics excels in modern combat. Want to run a game where the Atlanta SWAT takes down gangs or a para-military operation in 'Nam? We've got you covered!

User summary:

Includes an optional magic system, optional "low-magic" items, and numerous firearms-related charts and tables.

190977.name: Ops and Tactics: GM Compendium and Player Resource
190977.description:
From the introduction:

This book is designed with the players and the Game Masters of Ops and Tactics in mind. It's meant to assist both parties in creating characters, worlds, and campaigns that are both successful and fun using the Ops and Tactics ruleset. Included are rule combinations, and rule suggestions and character creation advice for both newcomers and seasoned veterans.

190978.name: Ops and Tactics: Character Folio
190978.description:
User summary:

An extensive character "sheet" for tracking all aspects of a character and their belongings. Spells & Magic, Psionics, and Incantations are all optional components and are two-pages each, leaving the "basic" character sheet a svelte seven pages.

Completely revised for Ops and Tactics 5th Edition.

190979.name: Ops and Tactics: Armory
190979.description:
From the introduction:

This book is a supplement to the Ops and Tactics RPG system, expanding the armor and firearm selection of the base Ops and Tactics Core Rulebook. This book is to used as a reference book, expanding the selection of firearms in the game, beyond the core rulebook, as well as a learning tool, to better understand each category of firearm, their intended uses, and tactics to use and develop on.

190980.name: Ops and Tactics: Modern Magika
190980.description:
From the introduction:

Wizardry and sorcery. Mystical forces. Spellcraft. Magic is called a very many things by a very many people. Some consider this mystical force to be wild, out of control, not-comprehensible by any known being, and ward against it's use for it's destructive and spoiling nature, while others see it as divine favor, given to sentient-kind as a gift, to be used responsibly. There is a third group, those who are able to understand and see the patterns in magic, and see it not as divine favor, nor as an uncontrollable force of nature, but as a science, who are able to use the patterns and the language of magic, into a controllable, scalable force. These people take on many titles, but the universally accepted title is a Mage.

190981.name: Ops and Tactics: Advanced Arms
190981.description:
From the introduction:

The Future can be a scary place. New technology, new weapons, and new enemies to watch out for. You never know if the next alley might contain an alien creature bent on destruction of the world, or two chem-heads looking for their next score.

Advanced Arms is a speculative look into the future of the world of Ops and Tactics, introducing new armors, weapons, and equipment, that can be used for futuristic campaigns.

190982.name: Ops and Tactics: Procedural Weapons
190982.description:
From the introduction:

This book is a supplement to the Ops and Tactics RPG system. This book is used to add new, interesting rules on top of the core rule book, in order to give weapons more flavor and more options to players.

190983.name: Ops and Tactics: Special Request Volume 1
190983.description:
User summary:

This document presents game data on several Russian weapons.

Designed for Ops and Tactics 5th Edition. Page orientation varies between portrait and landscape.

190984.name: Ops and Tactics: Special Request Volume 2
190984.description:
User summary:

This document presents game data on several variants (most obscure) of the Colt M1911 pistol.

Designed for Ops and Tactics 5th Edition. Page orientation varies between portrait and landscape.

190985.name: Ops and Tactics: Special Request Volume 3
190985.description:
User summary:

This document presents game data on several quite obscure weapons, including several odd-caliber handguns.

Designed for Ops and Tactics 5th Edition. Page orientation varies between portrait and landscape.

190986.name: Ops and Tactics: Supply Drop Volume 1
190986.description:
User summary:

This book is a supplement to the Ops and Tactics RPG system. This book is used to add new, interesting rules on top of the core rule book, in order to give weapons more flavor and more options to players.

Volume 1 includes data on "big guns" - high-caliber firearms.

Designed for Ops and Tactics 5th Edition. Page orientation varies between portrait and landscape.

190987.name: Ops and Tactics: Supply Drop Volume 2
190987.description:
User summary:

This book is a supplement to the Ops and Tactics RPG system. This book is used to add new, interesting rules on top of the core rule book, in order to give weapons more flavor and more options to players.

Volume 2 includes riot gear and SWAT equipment.

Designed for Ops and Tactics 5th Edition. Page orientation varies between portrait and landscape.

190988.name: Ops and Tactics: Supply Drop Volume 3
190988.description:
User summary:

This book is a supplement to the Ops and Tactics RPG system. This book is used to add new, interesting rules on top of the core rule book, in order to give weapons more flavor and more options to players.

Volume 3 presents simplified firearms and ammo rules, for players who "either don't know or care what the differences are between" various types of weapons.

Designed for Ops and Tactics 5th Edition. Page orientation varies between portrait and landscape.

190989.name: Ops and Tactics: Supply Drop Volume 4
190989.description:
User summary:

This book is a supplement to the Ops and Tactics RPG system. This book is used to add new, interesting rules on top of the core rule book, in order to give weapons more flavor and more options to players.

Volume 4 presents data on "restricted" weapons, primarily short-barreled rifles and short-barreled shotguns.

Designed for Ops and Tactics 5th Edition. Page orientation varies between portrait and landscape.

190990.name: Ops and Tactics: Supply Drop Volume 5
190990.description:
User summary:

This book is a supplement to the Ops and Tactics RPG system. This book is used to add new, interesting rules on top of the core rule book, in order to give weapons more flavor and more options to players.

Volume 5 presents data on "fantasy" firearms and equipment, primarily derived from films and fiction.

Designed for Ops and Tactics 5th Edition. Page orientation varies between portrait and landscape.

190991.name: Ops and Tactics: Supply Drop Volume 6
190991.description:
User summary:

This book is a supplement to the Ops and Tactics RPG system. This book is used to add new, interesting rules on top of the core rule book, in order to give weapons more flavor and more options to players.

Volume 6 presents data on firearms curiosa - oddball calibers and oddball guns.

Designed for Ops and Tactics 5th Edition. Page orientation varies between portrait and landscape.

190992.name: Ops and Tactics: Supply Drop Volume 7
190992.description:
User summary:

This book is a supplement to the Ops and Tactics RPG system. This book is used to add new, interesting rules on top of the core rule book, in order to give weapons more flavor and more options to players.

Volume 7 presents game data on sniper rifles and basic fieldcraft.

Designed for Ops and Tactics 5th Edition. Page orientation varies between portrait and landscape.

190993.name: Ops and Tactics: Supply Drop Volume 8
190993.description:
From the introduction:

Ops and Tactics begins with Archetypes designed to provide as much freedom as possible while still remaining unique, but they are limited in their function. This supply drop (Volume 8) adds a new archetype to the core ruleset, a variant archetype that is classless, and the ability for players and GMs to build their own races.

190994.name: Ops and Tactics: Supply Drop Volume 9
190994.description:
From the introduction:

This Supply drop introduces some more classic equipment that is used by your average dungeoneer, fit for the Ops and Tactics Ruleset.

190995.name: Cyberblues City
190995.description:
From the introduction:

Cyberblues is a lot like cyberpunk, only more mellow. The game is set in an entirely fictional, near-future dystopia in which the rich 1% own 99% of the world's resources, supported by militarised police forces, global surveillance systems and by the mainstream media outlets which they control. It's a world where fairness took an extended lunch break and never came back.

Characters in Cyberblues City are the kind of people who with guns, guile and superior technical skills try to make a difference. Or maybe they're just out to make a buck.

190996.name: Drama & Dice
190996.description:
From the introduction:

The Drama & Dice rules assume some familiarity with the most basic features of RPGs - how players portray characters, how GMs weave worlds, and so on.

User summary:

Character creation is quite free-form, with players "inventing" one to ten Skills and distributing points among them. Atypically, the Gm then invents basic descriptions and backstory for the player's character. Actions are resolved by rolling a dice pool (often a single dice) and trying to "roll under" the related Skill rating. The number of dice and the type of dice (e.g., D4, D6, D8, etc.) is determined by the GM to establish difficulty.

190997.name: 90 Minutes of Mayhem!!
190997.description:
User summary:

Characters are created from various Traits selected by the player during creation. Characters have an "ex-profession" and a current "profession", a "style", and three "signature moves". These should all be combined into a brief biographic paragraph. Characters have a dice pool; actions are resolved by consulting a simple action table.

190998.name: Worlds Without Master (Volume 1, Issue 11 - Jul 2016)
190998.description:
(publisher blurb)

Issue eleven of Worlds Without Master, an adventure fiction and gaming magazine featuring sword & sorcery short fiction and games from Epidiah Ravachol and many others.

In this issue:

"The Shape of the World" - A tale by Epidiah Ravachol
"The Spirits of the Forest Apes" - A tale by Dylan Craine
"Wolf Neighbours" - A comic by Rachel Kahn
"Amazons" - A game by Vincent Baker

190999.name: Take On Mars
190999.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




From the Publisher / Developer Website
Take On Mars places you right in the middle of mankind's most exciting undertaking. Start out in the seat of a rover operator, pushing your vehicles to the max. Finish as the first human to have ever set foot on Mars. With a scientific arsenal at your disposal, you will pioneer the exploration of another planet, unlocking the secrets of its distant past.

Mars
Also known as the Red Planet, Mars has been the object of human curiosity for decades. Located at an average distance of 225 million kilometer from Earth, it is the second smallest planet in our Solar System, and is primarily composed of silicate rocks and metals. Many geologists have speculated about the presence of liquid water on the planet. But while this would answer hundreds of scientific questions about the Universe, and even the search for extra-terrestrial life, solid evidence has yet to be found.

Rovers & Landers
Standing at the center of a billion-dollar enterprise, Mars Rovers and stationary landers belong to humanity’s greatest achievements in space engineering. They are designed to withstand unforgiving Martian terrain and weather conditions, while the cutting-edge instruments on board are designed to perform complex analysis tasks, and transmit the results back to Earth.

Manned Mission
Even though we are still years away from sending the first humans to Mars, some scientists believe it will be possible as early as 2023. The challenges involved include a range of technological, financial, physical and even psychological factors. Regardless, being able to witness the first manned mission to Mars is considered the number one fantasy of any space enthusiast.

191000.name: Word Speed
191000.description: Players race to spell words combining the consonant cards in their hand with the vowel dice in the Dice Slide. The first to state their word wins the hand.
